text: And he went forth again by the sea side ; and all the multitude resorted unto him , and he taught them .
text2: Nuna dutika ukuak ataktú weuwai kuchá tugkitken . Nuishkam aentsuk imatiksag tuwajuidau , dutikam niishkam jintinkagtau .

text: And as he passed by , he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom , and said unto him , Follow me . And he arose and followed him .
text2: Nui nagkaemakmá Leví Alfeo uchijin wainkauwai , kuichik apunu atinun akikmagtai yajumak ekeemtatman . Nunik : — Wegajai , mina jintintaig aminum , — tiuwai . Tama Levishkam wajakí Jisusjai weuwai .

text: And it came to pass , that , as Jesus sat at meat in his house , many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples : for there were many , and they followed him .
text2: Nunik nunú tsawantaik Jisus Leví jeen jegaa mesanum jegantá ekeemsau . Nuwig apú kuichkiji atinun yajumin aidaushkam Jisusa jintintaiji aidaujai ijunag nunú mesanmag jegantag ekeemsajui , kuashat niina saetus yujaidau asag .

text: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners , they said unto his disciples , How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Nunittaman chicham umiktinun jintinkagtin aidau , fariseo aidaujai , wainkag Jisusa jintintaiji aidaun chichajuinak : — ¿ Wajuk asaya atumin jintinjamnush apú kuichkiji atinun yajumin nuigtú aents pegkegchau aina ibaujaish ijuntug yuwakush , umutnash ijuntusash umawa ? — tuidau .

text: When Jesus heard it , he saith unto them , They that are whole have no need of the physician , but they that are sick : I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Nu tabaun Jisus antuk ayaak : — Aents jamamtuchu aidauk ampijatnunak atsumtsame , aents jau aidau ampijatnunak atsumame . Wika aents tudaugtuchu aidaunak minitchauwaitjai , wika aents tudaugtin aidaun minitiuwaitjai .

text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast : and they come and say unto him , Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast , but thy disciples fast not ?
text2: Juagká jintintaiji aidau , fariseo aidaushkam yujumkan ijagmakag Apajuin aujuinak batsataidau , nuninai wajumak Jisusan jegantun iniinak : — ¿ Wagka Juan Yamijatna nuna jintintaiji aidauk , fariseo aidaujai yujumkan ijagmainaish , ame jintintaijum aidaush ijagmainatsua ? — tuidau .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Can the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ? as long as they have the bridegroom with them , they cannot fast .
text2: Tama Jisus ayaak : — ¿ Nuwena nunú aents ipaamu aidaush , nu nuwenu ditajai pujaigkish yujumkan ijagmak pekamainkaih ? Nuwenu ditajai pujaigkik yujumkanak ijagmamaitsui .

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: Tujash tsawan jegattawai nuwena nunú juwam atata nu , nunikmatai ipaamu aidaush wake besemag dekapenak yujumkanak ijagmakagtatui .

text: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment : else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old , and the rent is made worse .
text2: Tusa ti junashkam tiuwai : “ Makichik aentskesh jaanch yamagman tsupikag jaanch mamujunmag adujtuchu ainawai , yamajam asa jaanch mamujun nuní nagkaemas ichiimain asamtai .

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles : else the new wine doth burst the bottles , and the wine is spilled , and the bottles will be marred : but new wine must be put into new bottles .
text2: Tuja makichkish uva yumiji yamá ijugbaunak , vino yajatai duwap apagbau ajutnumag yajachu ainawai , dutikamak vino yamajam asa , kajiak pushutak ipati ukagag duwapjai ajapnamain asamtai . Duwi uva yumiji yamá ijugbauk duwap yamajam apagbaunum yajataiyai . ”

text: And it came to pass , that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day ; and his disciples began , as they went , to pluck the ears of corn .
text2: Tsawan ayamtai tsawaju ai , Jisus ni jintintaiji aidaujai trigo ajakbaunum nagkaebau . Nuniamunum niina jintintaiji aidau trigon kupig juidau .

text: And the Pharisees said unto him , Behold , why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful ?
text2: Nuniagtai fariseo aidau wainkag : — Nijah ¿ wagka amina jintintaijum aidaush , tsawan ayamtai tsawagmataig takantsashti tibauwa nunin aish aikainawa ? — tuidau .

text: And he said unto them , Have ye never read what David did , when he had need , and was an hungred , he , and they that were with him ?
text2: Tusa tiagtai Jisus ayaak : — ¿ Atumek agagbauk ausachuk ainajum , David niijai yujaamujai yapajuinak ,

text: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest , and did eat the shewbread , which is not lawful to eat but for the priests , and gave also to them which were with him ?
text2: Abiatar sumo sacerdote wajas pujai , jega Apajuí ememattainum wayaa , pag imá sacerdotek yuwati tibauwa nuna juki yuwak aents niijai yujaunash ayugkauwa duka ?

text: And he said unto them , The sabbath was made for man , and not man for the sabbath :
text2: Tsawan ayamtaiya duka aents pimpiak ayamjatnume tusa aikamui . Aentsuk tsawan ayamtai tsawautai nuna umigkatin atinme tichamui .

text: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: Nuniau asamtai , wika Apajuí Uchijiyaitkun Aentsmagan Akiinau asan , tsawan ayamtai tsawagmataish wajukmainaita nunak wikitjai tumainnuk , — tiuwai .

text: And he entered again into the synagogue ; and there was a man there which had a withered hand .
text2: Jisus ataktú jega ijuntainum wayau , nuanuí aents uwejen chuwijú pujau .

text: And they watched him , whether he would heal him on the sabbath day ; that they might accuse him .
text2: Nuniau asamtai tsawan ayamtaiya junin aish etsagagchatpash etsagagmataig etsegtuka bakumí tusag dii ijuntuidau .

text: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand , Stand forth .
text2: Nuninaig Jisus aents uwejen chuwijun chichajak : — Wajakim ejapeen wajantá , — tiuwai .

text: And he saith unto them , Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days , or to do evil ? to save life , or to kill ? But they held their peace .
text2: Nuna ti , tikich aidaun chichajak : — ¿ Tsawan ayamtai aina nuwish pegkeja duka takamainait , atsa pegkegchauk dutikmainait , tsawan ayamtai tsawaje tusaik , aentsuk etsagautsuk jakati tusa idaimainait ? — tau . Tamash ditak aimainachu .

text: And when he had looked round about on them with anger , being grieved for the hardness of their hearts , he saith unto the man , Stretch forth thine hand . And he stretched it out : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: Nuna ti kajeká diisú , aents aidau dekaskeapi tuinachu asagmatai . Nunik jaun chichajak : — Uwejum dakuekta , — tiuwai . Tama niishkam uwejen dakueku , nuniamuik uwejenig pegkeg wajasuí .

text: And the Pharisees went forth , and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him , how they might destroy him .
text2: Jisus nuna dutikamtai fariseo aidau , Herodesan aentsji aidaujai agaa jiinjag , Jisusan maatasag chichaman umikajui .

text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea : and a great multitude from Galilee followed him , and from Judaea ,
text2: Tujash Jisusak ni jintintaiji aidaujai kuchanum wegajui , nuniai kuashat aents Galileanmaya aidau , Judeanmaya aidaushkam ,

text: And from Jerusalem , and from Idumaea , and from beyond Jordan ; and they about Tyre and Sidon , a great multitude , when they had heard what great things he did , came unto him .
text2: Jerusalegnumiashkam , Idumianmaya aidaush , Jordagka amain batsamin aidaushkam , nuigtú Tiro , Sidón aina nuwi tikiju batsamin aidaush minitiajui , Jisus kuashat iwainaka takaamun antukaju asag wainkagtatus .

text: And he spake to his disciples , that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude , lest they should throng him .
text2: Imanidau asamtai Jisus ni jintintaiji aidaun : — Bote shiig umisjum inanastajum , aents kuashat kaunainak chanuntuawainum , — tiuwai .

text: For he had healed many ; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him , as many as had plagues .
text2: Jisus kuashat jaun etsagaku asamtai , aents jau aidauk niina antigkagtatus tuwajuidau .

text: And unclean spirits , when they saw him , fell down before him , and cried , saying , Thou art the Son of God .
text2: Tuja wakan pegkegchau aentsú egkemtuju aidauk Jisusan wainkag , nuna aentsun tikishmitkajag , senchi jiiká : — Amek Apajuí Uchijiyaitme , — tuidau .

text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known .
text2: Tujash Jisusak senchi jiyau , dekajuawainum tau asa .

text: And he goeth up into a mountain , and calleth unto him whom he would : and they came unto him .
text2: Nuna dutika Jisus niina nemajus yujaina nuna yajuak mujanum wakauwai .

text: And he ordained twelve , that they should be with him , and that he might send them forth to preach ,
text2: Dutika nuanuiyan doce tuke niijai ijunja wekaesatin aidaun , nuigtushkam niina chichamen etsegkati tusa ishiaktinji aidaunash etegjauwai .

text: And to have power to heal sicknesses , and to cast out devils :
text2: Dutikak jau aidau etsagagtinun , nuigtú wakan pegkegchau egkemtugbau aidau jiiktinnashkam senchijin susauwai .

text: And Simon he surnamed Peter ;
text2: Nunú aidauk ju ainawai : Simón , Jisus Pedro atatme timawa nu ,

text: And James the son of Zebedee , and John the brother of James ; and he surnamed them Boanerges , which is , The sons of thunder :
text2: Jacobo ni yachi Juagjai , Zebedeo uchijí aidaun Jisus Boanerges adaikajua nu ( nunak ipamta uchijí aidau tusa tawai ) .

text: And Andrew , and Philip , and Bartholomew , and Matthew , and Thomas , and James the son of Alphaeus , and Thaddaeus , and Simon the Canaanite ,
text2: Andrés , Felipe , Bartolomé , Mateo , Tomás , Jacobo Alfeo uchijí , tikich Simón niina nugken agkanmitkatatus kuashat aents aidaujai chichajakua nu .

text: And Judas Iscariot , which also betrayed him : and they went into an house .
text2: Judas Iscariote Jisusan sujukua nunú . Dutika adaijam jegá kaunawajui .

text: And the multitude cometh together again , so that they could not so much as eat bread .
text2: Nunikmatai ataktushkam aents aidau tuwagkag yujumkash yumain awajuinachu .

text: And when his friends heard of it , they went out to lay hold on him : for they said , He is beside himself .
text2: Nuna antukag Jisusa patayí aidau jukitasag kautuawaju , anentainkachu wajas wekaetsuash tusag .

text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said , He hath Beelzebub , and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils .
text2: Nuigtushkam chicham umiktinun jintinkagtin aidau Jerusalegnumia kaunawaju , Jisusan chichajuinak : “ Juka Beelzebú , wakan pegkegchau aidau apujiya nuna senchijin wakan pegkegchaunak jiyaawai ” , tuidau .

text: And he called them unto him , and said unto them in parables , How can Satan cast out Satan ?
text2: Tiagtai Jisus nuna antuk , ditan untsukag augmatbaun pachitus chichajak : “ ¿ Wajukaya mai iwanchkesh jiinimainaita ?

text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself , that kingdom cannot stand .
text2: Makichik nugkanmag batsatiatak pempeentunikiag maaní batsatkujag megkaemain ainawai .

text: And if a house be divided against itself , that house cannot stand .
text2: Tuja tikitchakam aents makichik jeganmag ijunag batsatiatak pempeentunikiag maaní batsatkushkam ditak megkaemain ainawai .

text: And if Satan rise up against himself , and be divided , he cannot stand , but hath an end .
text2: Aantsag iwanchia dushakam pempeentuniki jiniakug , niina senchijinak megkaemainai .

text: No man can enter into a strong man ' s house , and spoil his goods , except he will first bind the strong man ; and then he will spoil his house .
text2: “ Aents senchigtina nuna jeen wayaag makichkish wajiijinak yajutmainchau ainawai nuna jigkatskek , untsu nuna jigkajá ashí wajiijinak yajutmain ainawai .

text: Verily I say unto you , All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men , and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme :
text2: “ Dekas tajime : Apajuik ashí aentsun tudaujinak tsagkugmainai , niina ashí pegkegchau pachis chichagkau aidaunashkam .

text: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness , but is in danger of eternal damnation :
text2: Tujash Wakaní Pegkejiya nuna pachis pegkegchaun chichagkau aidauk , atakea duwish tuke tsagkujam achagtinai , nuniau asag nuna tiajuk suwimak ajumaish tuke atina nuna jukiagtinai . ”

text: Because they said , He hath an unclean spirit .
text2: Nunak Jisusak Wakaní Pegkejiya nujai takaunak , iwanchin senchijiya nujai takaawai tabau asa tiuwai .

text: There came then his brethren and his mother , and , standing without , sent unto him , calling him .
text2: Nuna tusa inagnaku ai Jisusa yachi aidau dukujijai kautuawaju , nunikag agaag ijuntsag anuí ujatjuktajum tiajui .

text: And the multitude sat about him , and they said unto him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee .
text2: Tuinam Jisusan tenteawag pekajuidau ujainak : — Amina duku yatsum aidaujai kautjamak egapainawai , — tuidau .

text: And he answered them , saying , Who is my mother , or my brethren ?
text2: Tusá ujaam ni chichaak : — ¿ Yaita mina dukug , mina yatsug aidaush ?

text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him , and said , Behold my mother and my brethren !
text2: Nuna tusa nui pekajuidaun ayampatua : — Jujú ainawai mina dukug , mina yatsug aidauk .

text: For whosoever shall do the will of God , the same is my brother , and my sister , and mother .
text2: Ashí aents Apajuí wakejamun takaina nuuwai mina dukug , mina yatsug , mina ubag aidauk , — tiuwai .

text: And he began again to teach by the sea side : and there was gathered unto him a great multitude , so that he entered into a ship , and sat in the sea ; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land .
text2: Nuwiya jiinki Jisus kuchanum jegamtai kuashat aents tuwagkajam , botenum egkemag ataktú jintinkagtau , aents aidauk kaamatak ijuntsamtai .

text: And he taught them many things by parables , and said unto them in his doctrine ,
text2: Nunik augmatbaun pachis kuashat jintinkagtak :

text: Hearken ; Behold , there went out a sower to sow :
text2: “ Ju shiig antuktajum : Ajakan ajakbau ajajin ajaka jigkayin nagkimak ukutatus weuwai , dutik ajakmau asa .

text: And it came to pass , as he sowed , some fell by the way side , and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up .
text2: Nunik jegantá ajajin jigkai nagkimam jintá kakekaunak yakiya pishak kaketuk amukuí .

text: And some fell on stony ground , where it had not much earth ; and immediately it sprang up , because it had no depth of earth :
text2: Tikich jigkai kayagnunum nugka imanik atsamunum kakekauwai , nunikuk wamkes tsapaidiajui ,

text: But when the sun was up , it was scorched ; and because it had no root , it withered away .
text2: nuniktatman etsa jiinak , kagkapé initak akaejachu asamtai apeká ijinauwai .

text: And some fell among thorns , and the thorns grew up , and choked it , and it yielded no fruit .
text2: Tuja tikich jigkai kakekajui jagki ayaunum , nunik tsapaittaman jagki yutuauwai , dutikamu asa ajakak nejeachui .

text: And other fell on good ground , and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased ; and brought forth , some thirty , and some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Tujash tikich jigkai nugka dekas pegkegnum kakekauwai , nunikajuk tsapaidiag muun wajas , makí makichik ajak aidauk treinta , tikich sesenta , tikich cien aatus nejekajui ” , tau .

text: And he said unto them , He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Nuna ti nuigtushkam : “ Dita antutaiji ajamuk antuktinme ” , tiuwai .

text: And when he was alone , they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable .
text2: Nuna jintinkagtua ashimkamtai , tikichik shimuinai ujumak juwakaju aidau ni jintintaiji aidaujai jegantag , augmattsa jintinkagtuamun pachisag iniidau .

text: And he said unto them , Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God : but unto them that are without , all these things are done in parables :
text2: Tama Jisus ditan chichajak : “ Atumnak Apajuí ni aentsnum inamjatnuji dekajakchamun wi pachisan etsejag junash dekamtijamatatus wakejutpagme . Tujash tikich aidauk dekamain ainatsui , nuna takumpap tawa tusajag , nuaduí augmatbaun pachisan ditanak tajai .

text: That seeing they may see , and not perceive ; and hearing they may hear , and not understand ; lest at any time they should be converted , and their sins should be forgiven them .
text2: Kuashat iwainajan takaamun wainainakush wainmachu wajukmaina nuninawai , antuinakushkam nunap tawa tusajag dekainatsui , nunidau asagmatai Apajuik ditá tudaujinak tsagkugmainchauwai . ”

text: And he said unto them , Know ye not this parable ? and how then will ye know all parables ?
text2: Junashkam tiuwai : “ ¿ Atumek jujú augmattsa tabauk dekatsjumek ? ¿ Aniautigmesh wajuk dekattajume , wi tikichin augmattsan takuish ?

text: The sower soweth the word .
text2: Ajakan ajakbau timag nunak : Apajuí chichamen etsegnun takun timajai .

text: And these are they by the way side , where the word is sown ; but when they have heard , Satan cometh immediately , and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts .
text2: Jintá jigkai kakekaun pishak amukú timag nunak : Aents Apajuí chichamen etsegbaun antakush dekaskeapi tachau asamtai , iwanch chicham antukbaujin sakapitka nuna takun timajai .

text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground ; who , when they have heard the word , immediately receive it with gladness ;
text2: Ajakan jigkayí kayagnunum kakekaju timag nunak : Aents Apajuí chichame etsegbaun yamaikik shiig aneas antukuitak

text: And have no root in themselves , and so endure but for a time : afterward , when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word ' s sake , immediately they are offended .
text2: utugchatan igkuak waitiak , pachitsuk idayidauk ; ajakan kagkapé initak akaejachu asa , etsa sukuam waamak jinuwama numamtuk wajaina nuna takun timajai .

text: And these are they which are sown among thorns ; such as hear the word ,
text2: Jigkai jagki ayaunum iyaaju timag nunashkam : Aents Apajuí chichamen antuinayatak ,

text: And the cares of this world , and the deceitfulness of riches , and the lusts of other things entering in , choke the word , and it becometh unfruitful .
text2: ju nugkaya wajiin imá senchi puyatjuinak , wiakchameatasag imá senchi anentaimtuina nuna takun timajai . Ashí ju nugkanmaya wají wakegamua nunú chicham pegkeg antukbaunak imanchau emawai .

text: And these are they which are sown on good ground ; such as hear the word , and receive it , and bring forth fruit , some thirtyfold , some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Untsu jigkai nugka pegkegnum shiig tsapaidiaju asag nejetnash imanik nejeawajui timag nunak : Aents Apajuí chichamen shiig dekaskeapi tusag , imá Apajuí wakejamunak takaina nuna takun timajai . Nunú aents aidauk , ajak treinta jigkain , sesenta , cien aatus nejekú aina numamtin ainawai . ”

text: And he said unto them , Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel , or under a bed ? and not to be set on a candlestick ?
text2: Junashkam chichaak : “ ¿ Lámpara ekemakaish , dukukaik dutikachkuish pegaká wakentinig aputayama ? ¿ Dutiktsuk yakí ekenchataigkama ?

text: For there is nothing hid , which shall not be manifested ; neither was any thing kept secret , but that it should come abroad .
text2: Anmamtuk ashí uukbau aidaush wantinkagtinai , aantsag ashí dekachbau aidaushkam dekaamu agtinai .

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Dita antutaiji ajuinamuk antuktinme . ”

text: And he said unto them , Take heed what ye hear : with what measure ye mete , it shall be measured to you : and unto you that hear shall more be given .
text2: Junashkam tiuwai : “ Atum antajum nunú shiig antukjum umitaik , Apajuishkam aan kuashat dekamtijamattawai .

text: For he that hath , to him shall be given : and he that hath not , from him shall be taken even that which he hath .
text2: Nuniau asamtai ni mina chichamjun dekaskeapi tusa shiig puyatjus antaunak aan nagkaemasan jintintuattajai , tuja ni mina chichamjun puyatjus antachuk machik antamujish kajimitkam atinai . ”

text: And he said , So is the kingdom of God , as if a man should cast seed into the ground ;
text2: Junashkam Jisus tiuwai : “ Apajuí aentsnum inama duka , aents ajaka jigkayin ajauwa nujai betekmamtinai .

text: And should sleep , and rise night and day , and the seed should spring and grow up , he knoweth not how .
text2: Nunik ajaa kanak tepaish tuja iwaa pujaishkam kashi tsawai aish jigkaik tsapaawai , nunik tsakawai ajauwa duka wajuk tsakaawa nunak dekatsaig .

text: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself ; first the blade , then the ear , after that the full corn in the ear .
text2: Nunak nugka nigki tsapapamu asa nuniawai , dekatkauk dupaya nunin tsapai tsakajá pasamjawai , nunik nejek ayatak jigkaik wegawai .

text: But when the fruit is brought forth , immediately he putteth in the sickle , because the harvest is come .
text2: Nunik tsamakmatai hozan juki jiintawai juuktatus , tsawan juumain jegau asamtai . ”

text: And he said , Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God ? or with what comparison shall we compare it ?
text2: Junashkam Jisus tiuwai : “ Apajuí aentsnum inama dusha ¿ wajijai apatkaya imá shiijash antumainaita ? ¿ Wají augmatbauwa yaijatmainaita Apajuik juní inamui tusa shiig dekamaina dusha ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which , when it is sown in the earth , is less than all the seeds that be in the earth :
text2: Juka mostazan jigkayí nugká ajatiama numamtinke . Ashí nugkanmaya jigkai aina nuwiya imá piipichik mostazan jigkayiya nuuwai .

text: But when it is sown , it groweth up , and becometh greater than all herbs , and shooteth out great branches ; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it .
text2: Nuninchitkushkam nugká ajaam tsakaakug kadaukdaugkin wegawai . Iman wajasmatai yakiya pishak aidaushkam nuna wakentí bikintunum pasugmainawai . Numamtuk Apajuishkam aents wajumkea nui inabaujin nagkama kuashat emawai . ”

text: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them , as they were able to hear it .
text2: Kuashat augmatbaun pachis jumamtin aidaun jintinkagtujakuí dita yupichu antumainun .

text: But without a parable spake he not unto them : and when they were alone , he expounded all things to his disciples .
text2: Augmatbaun tutsukek jintinkagtujakchauwai , untsu niina jintintaiji aidaunak ashí nuna takun tajai tusa dekamtikajakuí .

text: And the same day , when the even was come , he saith unto them , Let us pass over unto the other side .
text2: Nunú tsawantai kiyagbaunum niina jintintaiji aidaun chichajak : — Amain wegagmi , — tiuwai .

text: And when they had sent away the multitude , they took him even as he was in the ship . And there were also with him other little ships .
text2: Tusa aents aidaunak akateg ukuinak Jisus botenum egketunak dutiksag jukiag wegajui . Nuniai tikich botenum minidaush aidau .

text: And there arose a great storm of wind , and the waves beat into the ship , so that it was now full .
text2: Nunik weenai dase shiig senchi kuchan umpuak tsukatmitkau , imaniau asa botenmag yumik yajanu .

text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship , asleep on a pillow : and they awake him , and say unto him , Master , carest thou not that we perish ?
text2: Imatiktai Jisus bote ukujin atamjutain atamjuk kanak tepettaman ishintainak : — ¡ Jintinkagtinuh ! ¿ Amek jutii jakektatag duka pachijattsumek ? — tuidau .

text: And he arose , and rebuked the wind , and said unto the sea , Peace , be still . And the wind ceased , and there was a great calm .
text2: Tama nantakí dasen jiyak idayak , nayantsanashkam : — ¡ Mijakta ! — tiuwai . Tamawaik kuchashkam mijak miyasuch yaunchuk aajakbauk nunisag we patamsauwai .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye so fearful ? how is it that ye have no faith ?
text2: Nuna dutika niina jintintaiji aidaun chichajak : — ¿ Wagka sapigmajume ? ¿ Wagka Apajuiyaish kajintsajum anentaimtsugme ? — tau .

text: And they feared exceedingly , and said one to another , What manner of man is this , that even the wind and the sea obey him ?
text2: Nuna dutikamtai senchi puyatkag sapigmakaju , nunikag ditak pempeentunikiag : — ¿ Jusha ya asamtaiya dasesh , kuchash antujuinawa ? — tudayinau .

text: And they came over unto the other side of the sea , into the country of the Gadarenes .
text2: Nunik Galilea kuchajin amain Gadaranmaya batsamtai nugkeen katigkaju .

text: And when he was come out of the ship , immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit ,
text2: Nuwi anumak botenmaya jinai , ukumatainmaya aents wakan pegkegchau egkemtugbau Jisusan tajuauwai .

text: Who had his dwelling among the tombs ; and no man could bind him , no , not with chains :
text2: Nunú aentsuk ukumatainum pujú , jiju ikagmauwai jigkajaish emetuatakamá tujinkamu .

text: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains , and the chains had been plucked asunder by him , and the fetters broken in pieces : neither could any man tame him .
text2: Jiju ikagmauwai uwejen jigkajá , dawenum jigkajá awajkamash tsujiag utsau , imaniau asa emetmainchau wajá wekagu .

text: And always , night and day , he was in the mountains , and in the tombs , crying , and cutting himself with stones .
text2: Nuniak kashi tsawaishkam mujanum , ukumatainmash wekagas untsumá wekagu , nuigtush kayá jukishkam ijubau .

text: But when he saw Jesus afar off , he ran and worshipped him ,
text2: Imaní wekagu asa , Jisusan atushat wainmawaik tupikatki jegantun tikishmatug pujujus ,

text: And cried with a loud voice , and said , What have I to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of the most high God ? I adjure thee by God , that thou torment me not .
text2: senchi untsumak : — ¡ Jisusah , Apajuí nayaimpinum pujuwa nuna uchijiyah ! ¿ Wagka amesh minaish miname ? Apajuí pachisan segajame , ¡ wait aneasam suwimkak sukagtusaipa !

text: For he said unto him , Come out of the man , thou unclean spirit .
text2: Nunak Jisus : — Wakan pegkegchauwah , aents jinkim ukuktá , — tibau asa tiuwai .

text: And he asked him , What is thy name ? And he answered , saying , My name is Legion : for we are many .
text2: Tutai Jisus iniak : — ¿ Amesh yaitpa ? — tau . Tama ni aiimak : — Wika Untsujiyaitjai , wagki jutiik kuashat asaja , — tiuwai .

text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country .
text2: Nuna ti Jisusan segainak : “ Wait aneasam yajá tikich nugkanmag awekagtipa , jutii pujag juwig idaikagtusta ” , tiajui .

text: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding .
text2: Nuanuí mujanum jegantatak kuashat kuchi yutaijin yuwinak ijunu asamtai ,

text: And all the devils besought him , saying , Send us into the swine , that we may enter into them .
text2: wakan pegkegchau Jisusan segainak : — Wait aneasam awi ishijatkata , au kuchi ijuna awi utsanawagmi , — tuidau .

text: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave . And the unclean spirits went out , and entered into the swine : and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea , ( they were about two thousand ; ) and were choked in the sea .
text2: Tiagtai Jisuschakam : — Wamkesjum wetajum , — tima wakan pegkegchau aidau aentsnak ukuinak , dos mil kuchi tumain ijununum utsanawajui . Dutikawajam kuchishkam pisajag betsag tajagak kuchanum najataunum utsanawag jinawajui .

text: And they that fed the swine fled , and told it in the city , and in the country . And they went out to see what it was that was done .
text2: Nunikagmatai kuchí kuitamin aidaushkam pisajag yaaktanum jegawag etsejuinak , ajanum batsataidaunash dutiksag ujakaju . Dutikawajam , wagkag ankae tusag diisagtatus shimutkaju .

text: And they come to Jesus , and see him that was possessed with the devil , and had the legion , sitting , and clothed , and in his right mind : and they were afraid .
text2: Nunik Jisus pujamunum jegakmag , wakan pegkegchau shiig kuashat chimpimtujam waitkam wekayin pegkeg wajas , jaanchin nugkujá Jisusai ayaumas eketun wainkag , senchi ishamkajui .

text: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil , and also concerning the swine .
text2: Nuna wainkau aidau tikich aidaunashkam ujaidau , aents wakan pegkegchau chimpimtuamu tsagajun , kuchi jinaamun pachisashkam .

text: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts .
text2: Nunikag Jisusan : — Wait aneasam ju ii nugkega juwig pujutsuk yajá weta , — tusag segajui .

text: And when he was come into the ship , he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him .
text2: Tusá tima Jisus wegak botenum egkemtai , wakan pegkegchau egkemtuamu etsagagbaushkam : — Wisha amijai wekaesatjai , — tusa segauwai .

text: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not , but saith unto him , Go home to thy friends , and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee , and hath had compassion on thee .
text2: Tujash Jisusak ayú tutsuk : — Dekas jeemin wetá pataim batsatbaunum , nunikam shiig kuashat Apajuí amina wajuk wait anenjamjae nunú pachisam ujaktá , — tiu .

text: And he departed , and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him : and all men did marvel .
text2: Tima wegak Decápolis jegaa , Jisus niina kuashat wait anenja nuna pachis etseju . Nunitai ashí puyatjukag diidau .

text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side , much people gathered unto him : and he was nigh unto the sea .
text2: Jisus botenum egkemag kuchá amain katigmatai , kuashat aents aidau tuwagkaju ; dutikam nigka nuwig kuchá tugkitkenig juwakui .

text: And , behold , there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue , Jairus by name ; and when he saw him , he fell at his feet ,
text2: Nui pujai jega ijuntaiya nuna apuji Jairo daagtin Jisusan wainak , jegantun tikishmatug pujus :

text: And besought him greatly , saying , My little daughter lieth at the point of death : I pray thee , come and lay thy hands on her , that she may be healed ; and she shall live .
text2: — Mina jegajuí wemí , mina nawantug ashí mayai ashinak tepaun ukukjai . Wait aneasam ame minim uwegmin antinjukta , dutikam nawanjush tsagag pujugtusti , — tusa segau .

text: And Jesus went with him ; and much people followed him , and thronged him .
text2: Tama Jisus niijai wegau , nunitai kuashat aents saetuidau asag Jisusan chanuidau .

text: And a certain woman , which had an issue of blood twelve years ,
text2: Nu imatikainamunum nuwa doce mijadai numpan puwak waitú pujú ,

text: And had suffered many things of many physicians , and had spent all that she had , and was nothing bettered , but rather grew worse ,
text2: nuniak kuashat ampijatin aidaunum wekagas ampimak ashí ni ajamuchijinak ashimkush , tsagautsuk nuní nagkaemas waitú wekayin ,

text: When she had heard of Jesus , came in the press behind , and touched his garment .
text2: Jisus pachisa augmatuinamun antuk , aents tuwakbaunum eteenki ukujin pataetuk Jisus jaanch pataká nugkuagbaujin antinkauwai .

text: For she said , If I may touch but his clothes , I shall be whole .
text2: Nigka : “ Imá Jisusa jaanchjinakesh antignuk tsagagtatjapi ” , tau asa .

text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up ; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague .
text2: Nunik antiamuik numpa puwamujinak megkaekauwai , nunisag ashí niina iyashinish pegkeg wegamun dekapjauwai .

text: And Jesus , immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him , turned him about in the press , and said , Who touched my clothes ?
text2: Nunitai Jisus niina senchijí jiinun dekapmamag , aents minidaun ayampatua : — ¿ Ya mina nugkutaijuish antinkae ?

text: And his disciples said unto him , Thou seest the multitude thronging thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
text2: Tutai niina jintintaiji aidau : — Kuashat aents tuwakaju asag chanumpaina nu wainiatkumek , ¿ ya antinkae tusamesh tame ?

text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing .
text2: Nu tamashkam Jisusak ashí diyau , yaki antinkame tusa wainkatatus .

text: But the woman fearing and trembling , knowing what was done in her , came and fell down before him , and told him all the truth .
text2: Nunitai nuwa Jisusa jaanchjin antig tsagajuk , senchi puyatuk kujaukmaikia Jisusan jegantun , tikishmatug pujus dekaskenum ashí ni waitiamujinak ujakú .

text: And he said unto her , Daughter , thy faith hath made thee whole ; go in peace , and be whole of thy plague .
text2: Tusá ujaam : — Nawantah , ame kajintsá anentaimam duwi tsagajume , shiig agkan anentaimsam wetá . Yamaik agkan wajasume , — tiuwai .

text: While he yet spake , there came from the ruler of the synagogue ' s house certain which said , Thy daughter is dead : why troublest thou the Master any further ?
text2: Eke chichaak wajai , apu Jairo jeen batsatu kaunawag jegantun ujainak : — Nawanjumek jakame ¿ itugkatasamea jintinkagtinush waitkame ? — tuidau .

text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken , he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue , Be not afraid , only believe .
text2: Nu tuinamun Jisus antuk , jega ijuntain apujiya nuna pempeentuki : — Puyatkaipa , ayatak kajintsam anentaimsata , — tiuwai .

text: And he suffered no man to follow him , save Peter , and James , and John the brother of James .
text2: Nuna tusa aents aidaunak , minigpajum tusa ukuak Pedron , Jacobon ni yachi Juagjai yajuak weuwai .

text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue , and seeth the tumult , and them that wept and wailed greatly .
text2: Nunik apú jeen jegakmá kuashat aents pampainak , buutuinak wake besemag batsatun wainkauwai .

text: And when he was come in , he saith unto them , Why make ye this ado , and weep ? the damsel is not dead , but sleepeth .
text2: Nuniai Jisus wayaak : — ¿ Wagka pampakjumesh buutush batsatjume ? nuwauchik jakache kanag tepawai , — tiuwai .

text: And they laughed him to scorn . But when he had put them all out , he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel , and them that were with him , and entereth in where the damsel was lying .
text2: Tutai dushikidau . Tujash nigka nuna ti , ashí aents nui batsatunak jiijá , nuwauchi apají , dukují , nuigtú ni jintintaiji kampatum aidaujai utsanauwai nuwauch jaka tepamunum .

text: And he took the damsel by the hand , and said unto her , Talitha cumi ; which is , being interpreted , Damsel , I say unto thee , arise .
text2: Nunik uwegnum achik : — ¡ Talita cumi ! — tiuwai . ( Nunak : “ Nuwauchih , amina tajame nantaktá ” , taku tiuwai . )

text: And straightway the damsel arose , and walked ; for she was of the age of twelve years . And they were astonished with a great astonishment .
text2: Tusa tamawaik nuwauch doce mijan ajamu jakaushkam nantakí wekagu . Nuna dutikamtai aents aidauk puyatjuk dii ijuntuidau .

text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it ; and commanded that something should be given her to eat .
text2: Nuniagtai Jisus : — Tikichkesh ujakaigpajum — tusa idayak : — Yutái susatajum yuwati , — tiuwai .

text: And he went out from thence , and came into his own country ; and his disciples follow him .
text2: Jisus nuwiya jinki ni nugken Nazaret wetai , niina jintintai aidaushkam niijai wegajui .

text: And when the sabbath day was come , he began to teach in the synagogue : and many hearing him were astonished , saying , From whence hath this man these things ? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him , that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands ?
text2: Nunik tsawan ayamtai tsawagmatai Jisus jega ijuntainum wayaa jintinkagtau . Nunitai antukag puyatjukag : — ¿ Jusha tuwí imatikash unuimajuita ? ¿ Itusaya imatikash dekawa wainchatai aidaunash iwainag taká junash ?

text: Is not this the carpenter , the son of Mary , the brother of James , and Joses , and of Juda , and Simon ? and are not his sisters here with us ? And they were offended at him .
text2: ¿ Ju María uchijí carpinterowe duchaukaih ? ¡ Ju Santiago , José , Judas , Simón aina nuna yachiyajama ! — tuidau — ¡ Nuigtush umayí aidaush jutiijai batsatajama ! — tusag pampantuidau , Jisusaig kajinas anentaimainachu asag .

text: But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , but in his own country , and among his own kin , and in his own house .
text2: Nuniagtai Jisus : — Apajuí etsegtin niina nugken pujusá etsegtaik , niina patayí aidaush , niina jeeniagkesh eme anentus antugchau ainawai , tujash tikich nugkanum wekagas etsegtaik shiig aneas antujin ainawai , — tiuwai .

text: And he could there do no mighty work , save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk , and healed them .
text2: Nuna tau asa nuwig dita wainkachbaujinak iwainajag takaschauwai , nuniayatak ujumchik jau aidaun uwejen buuknum achik etsagakui .

text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief . And he went round about the villages , teaching .
text2: Ditak dekaskeapi tuinachu asamtai puyatjuk anentai jegagchauwai . Nunik tikiju yaakat ayaunum wekagas jintinkagtau .

text: And he called unto him the twelve , and began to send them forth by two and two ; and gave them power over unclean spirits ;
text2: Nunik ni jintintaiji doce aina nuna untsuk ijumag , jimá jimajan apatuk ishimak , wakan pegkegchau aidau jiimainnash senchijin susauwai .

text: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey , save a staff only ; no scrip , no bread , no money in their purse :
text2: Dutika : — Jintá wegaku atsumainuk ayatak ushujutaigmek jukitajum . Makichkish jukigpajum jintá wegaku atsumainuk , wají egkesá jutaigkesh , yuwatnukesh , kuichkikesh jukigpa .

text: But be shod with sandals ; and not put on two coats .
text2: Ayatak sapatik wegamaktajum , nuniakjumesh yachia nugkugtinuk jukigpajum ,

text: And he said unto them , In what place soever ye enter into an house , there abide till ye depart from that place .
text2: — tusa , nuigtú ditan chichajak : — Atum tu jeganma wayattagme , nunikjumek nuwig pujusjum wegakjum ukuktajum .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear you , when ye depart thence , shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them . Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Untsu atum tu yaaktanma jegattagme nuniagmin nuwiya aents aidau ditá jeen jujamtan dakitjamainak , atum chicham etsegbaun antutnash dakituinakuig , nunú yaaktak ukuakjum atumi dawemin nugka awa nu pegagjum akakekjum ukuktajum , dita suwimak jukitnuji iwaintakjum . Dekas tajime : Atak Apajuí aents suwimak suwamu atina nuaduí Sodoma , Gomorranmaya aents aidaujai suwimak susamua nuna nagkagas suwimkan jukiagtin ainawai , — tiuwai .

text: And they went out , and preached that men should repent .
text2: Tima jintintaiji aidau shiyakag , aents aidaun : Tudaujum idaikujum Apajuí nemagkatajum , tuidau .

text: And they cast out many devils , and anointed with oil many that were sick , and healed them .
text2: Nuninak wakan pegkegchau aentsun egkemtuju aidaunash jiijag ishimainak , jau aidaunashkam buuken aceitiyai nijak etsagaidau .

text: And king Herod heard of him ; ( for his name was spread abroad : ) and he said , That John the Baptist was risen from the dead , and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: Apu Herodes Jisus pachisa augmatuinamun antuku , Jisusa daajig ashí yantamnum wantinjau asamtai nuna antuk : “ Duka Juan Yamijatin maamua nu nantakiu asa , senchigtin wajas imaniawai ” , tau .

text: Others said , That it is Elias . And others said , That it is a prophet , or as one of the prophets .
text2: Tutai tikich chichaidau : “ Auk Eliasai ” tuinai , tikich chichaidau : “ Apajuí etsegtinai nuniachkush Apajuí etsegtin aajakú aina dutsukaitai ” , tuidau .

text: But when Herod heard thereof , he said , It is John , whom I beheaded : he is risen from the dead .
text2: Nunú tuinamun Herodes antuk : — Auk Juan wi buuké tsupigkatajum tima tsupijuk maawajamia nunú nantakne , — tiuwai .

text: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John , and bound him in prison for Herodias ' sake , his brother Philip ' s wife : for he had married her .
text2: Nunak Herodesak nigki Juan achiktajum tima shimutkag , achikag jiju ikagmauwai jigkajag aents achiká egketainum egkeau aajakuí , ni yachi Felipe nuwen Herodiasan nuwatuk pujutai ,

text: For John had said unto Herod , It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother ' s wife .
text2: Juan chichajak : “ Herodesah , amek yatsumi nuweg nuwatkamek pujumaitsume ” ,

text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him , and would have killed him ; but she could not :
text2: tabaun Herodías antuk kajejuk maatatus wakegayatak dutikmainchau dekapeau .

text: For Herod feared John , knowing that he was a just man and an holy , and observed him ; and when he heard him , he did many things , and heard him gladly .
text2: Wagki Herodesak ishamau , Juagkak aents pegkeg tudaunash takachun dekau asa . Iman asamtai ayatak kuitamu , nuniau asa tamash puyatayatak wakejus antau .

text: And when a convenient day was come , that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords , high captains , and chief estates of Galilee ;
text2: Nuniamunum Herodes ni akiinamuji tsawagmatai jistamak , yutai umikbaun ni aentsji aidaujai nuigtú comandante , apu Galileanmaya aidaujai ijunag yuwinak pekagbaunum ,

text: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in , and danced , and pleased Herod and them that sat with him , the king said unto the damsel , Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt , and I will give it thee .
text2: Herodiasa nawanji wayaa nantsebau , nuniak Herodesan nuigtú niijai mesanum pekajuidaunashkam shiig awajkauwai . Nunikmatai apu nuwan chichajak : — Ame wakegamu segattá , tujutkuminig amastajai , — ti , nuigtú :

text: And he sware unto her , Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me , I will give it thee , unto the half of my kingdom .
text2: — Wi taja nunak dekas dutikattajai , wi inamag jukesh jimaituk segatkuminish dekas amamain asan tajame , — tiuwai .

text: And she went forth , and said unto her mother , What shall I ask ? And she said , The head of John the Baptist .
text2: Tima jiinki dukujin jegajua : — ¿ Wajinak tujuta nunash segatja ? — tau . Tama dukují ayaak : — Juan Yamijatna nuna buuké segatá , — tau .

text: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king , and asked , saying , I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist .
text2: Tima nuwauchishkam wamkes wakettsag apu pujamunum wayau , nunik : — Yamaikiuch Juan Yamijatnun buuken , platunum egkejá sujustí tusan wakegajai , — tau .

text: And the king was exceeding sorry ; yet for his oath ' s sake , and for their sakes which sat with him , he would not reject her .
text2: Tama Herodes shiig senchi wake besekú , nuniayatak ditajai pekajaidaush antuinamunum , dekas amastatjame tiu asa yapajimainchau dekapjau .

text: And immediately the king sent an executioner , and commanded his head to be brought : and he went and beheaded him in the prison ,
text2: Nuniku asa apushkam makichik suntajan awemauwai , Juagká buuké tsupikam utitá , tusa .

text: And brought his head in a charger , and gave it to the damsel : and the damsel gave it to her mother .
text2: Tima suntajishkam aents achiká egketainum jegá Juagká buuken tsupigkau , dutika platunum egkea itan nuwauchin susau , dutikam ni juki dukujin susauwai .

text: And when his disciples heard of it , they came and took up his corpse , and laid it in a tomb .
text2: Nu dutikamun Juagká jintintaiji dekawag kautuk , iyashin jukiag ukusajui .

text: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus , and told him all things , both what they had done , and what they had taught .
text2: Jisus chicham etsegtugkatajum tusa ishiakbau waketug kaunkag , Jisusan : — Nuní takasmaji , aaja jintinkagtuamji , tusag — ujaidau .

text: And he said unto them , Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place , and rest a while : for there were many coming and going , and they had no leisure so much as to eat .
text2: Tama ni ayaak : — Wegagmi , agkan aents atsamunum nunika machik ayamsagmi , — tiuwai . Nunak tikich waketiagtaish , tikich minii wajaidau asagmatai , yujumak yumainush agkan atsugbau asa , tiuwai .

text: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately .
text2: Nunik botenum chimpimjag ditak shiyakajui nugka agkantunum .

text: And the people saw them departing , and many knew him , and ran afoot thither out of all cities , and outwent them , and came together unto him .
text2: Tujash nunik wetatman kuashat aents aidau wainkag , kukag juwakiag we weenakua , ditá Jisus anumkatnunum jegawaju .

text: And Jesus , when he came out , saw much people , and was moved with compassion toward them , because they were as sheep not having a shepherd : and he began to teach them many things .
text2: Jisus botenmaya jinkamá shiig kuashat aents tuwaká ijunun wainkau , nunik wait anenmain diisuí , uwig kuitamainji atsugbau wajukmaina numamtuk wajaidau asagmatai . Dutikak shiig kuashat jintintu .

text: And when the day was now far spent , his disciples came unto him , and said , This is a desert place , and now the time is far passed :
text2: Nuniai etsashkam akagu asamtai , niina jintintaiji aidau : — Juwig jutiik aents atsamunum batsatji , etsash akaewai .

text: Send them away , that they may go into the country round about , and into the villages , and buy themselves bread : for they have nothing to eat .
text2: Aentsuk ishiakta , yaaktanum jegattak aents batsata nui aja tikiju aina nui wegag dita yuwatnujin sumaktinme , dita yumainuk atsawai , — tuidau .

text: He answered and said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they say unto him , Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread , and give them to eat ?
text2: Tiagtai ni ayaak : — Atum dita yuwatnuk susatajum , — tiuwai . Tama dita aiinak : — ¿ Jutii shiyakaiyash doscientos tsawan takasá kuichik jumaina ibauwaiyash pag sumaka ayugkatag ? — tuidau .

text: He saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? go and see . And when they knew , they say , Five , and two fishes .
text2: Tiagtai ni ayaak : — ¿ Wajupa pag ajutjamainawa ? wejum diistajum . Tima wegag : — Cinco pag nuigtú jimagchik namak amae , — tuidau .

text: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass .
text2: Tusa ujakam : — Aents aidau yajuakjum chijichi aina anuí shiig akanjajum batsagtajum , — tusa ishiakui .

text: And they sat down in ranks , by hundreds , and by fifties .
text2: Tiajam ditashkam cien aentsun ijumag batsainai , tikich cincuenta ijumush aidau .

text: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes , he looked up to heaven , and blessed , and brake the loaves , and gave them to his disciples to set before them ; and the two fishes divided he among them all .
text2: Dutikawagmatai cinco pagkan nuigtú jimagchik namaka nuna juki , nayaimpinum pagkai see tusa , pagkan puujá jintintaiji aidaun susaju , dita aentsun tinamkatnume tusa . Dutiksag namak jimaja nunashkam ashí tinamkau .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled .
text2: Dutikawajam ashí shiig yuwawag ejemakaju .

text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments , and of the fishes .
text2: Nunikagmatai pag mamayakjai ampinkaunak yajuakag doce chagkinnum aimjaju .

text: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men .
text2: Junak cinco mil aishmag aidau yuwawajui .

text: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship , and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida , while he sent away the people .
text2: Nuna yuwawag nagkanaig niina jintintaiji aidaunak : — Atumek botenum chimpimjajum amain Betsaida katigtajum . Tusa ishimak aents aidaun aujus ishiaktatus juwakui .

text: And when he had sent them away , he departed into a mountain to pray .
text2: Nunik aentsun aujus ukuak mujanum wakauwai Apajin ausatatus .

text: And when even was come , the ship was in the midst of the sea , and he alone on the land .
text2: Nuniai kiyaju , boteshkam kuchanum ejapean wegai nigki kukag juwaku .

text: And he saw them toiling in rowing ; for the wind was contrary unto them : and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them , walking upon the sea , and would have passed by them .
text2: Nunikmá wainkau dase igku umpuamu asa , wiya wiyantuinakua pimpikiag tsawampaidaun . Nuniamunum niishkam yuminum wekagas ayaumas nagkaikitatus ditan adijkau .

text: But when they saw him walking upon the sea , they supposed it had been a spirit , and cried out :
text2: Nunik yumí awanken wekagas minittaman wainkag , dita anentaimsajag pasun minatsuash tusag senchi untsumaidau ,

text: For they all saw him , and were troubled . And immediately he talked with them , and saith unto them , Be of good cheer : it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: ashí wainaidau asag ishamainak . Imatiagtai Jisus chichaak : — ¡ Witjai ishamjukaigpajum ! — tiuwai .

text: And he went up unto them into the ship ; and the wind ceased : and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure , and wondered .
text2: Tusa botenum egkemjamtai daseshkam mijaku ; nunikmatai senchi puyatkag anentai jegagchaju .

text: For they considered not the miracle of the loaves : for their heart was hardened .
text2: Nunak Jisus namak puujá ikaugka ajamamunash shiig anentaimjag dekaachaju asag , utujimas anentaimaidau .

text: And when they had passed over , they came into the land of Gennesaret , and drew to the shore .
text2: Nunia nuniakua kuchá amain katigkag Genesaret nugkanum kaamatak anumkaju .

text: And when they were come out of the ship , straightway they knew him ,
text2: Nunik jiinainaig Jisusnak aents aidauk wainkaju .

text: And ran through that whole region round about , and began to carry about in beds those that were sick , where they heard he was .
text2: Nunikag ashí yaaktanmayan shimutkag jau aidaunak pegakjin pataidiag Jisus nui pujawai tabaun antuinakug nui emaidau .

text: And whithersoever he entered , into villages , or cities , or country , they laid the sick in the streets , and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment : and as many as touched him were made whole .
text2: Dutikaidau asag aents yaakat batsamin aidau , yaaktan ukukiag batsamin , ajajin batsamin aidaushkam , jaun yajuakag jintanum batsaidau , dutikam : Idaikagtusta ame pataká nugkuajam nuna nagkattsamujigkesh antigkagmi , tusag segaidau . Tuja ashí aents Jisusa jaanchjin antidauk tsagainau .

text: Then came together unto him the Pharisees , and certain of the scribes , which came from Jerusalem .
text2: Fariseo aidau , chicham umiktinun jintinkagtin Jerusalegnumia kaunawaju aidaujai , Jisusan jegaantajui .

text: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled , that is to say , with unwashen , hands , they found fault .
text2: Nunikag Jisusa jintintaiji aidau ikigmatsuk yutatman wainak , anmainchaun aaninawai tusag chichaman patatuidau .

text: For the Pharisees , and all the Jews , except they wash their hands oft , eat not , holding the tradition of the elders .
text2: Fariseo aidauk , ashí judío aidaushkam ditá muunji aidau : Ikigmatskek yuchatai atí , tibau asamtai , tuidau .

text: And when they come from the market , except they wash , they eat not . And many other things there be , which they have received to hold , as the washing of cups , and pots , brasen vessels , and of tables .
text2: Ditak , yutai sujutainum wejum taakjumesh ikigmatskek yuwawaigpajum tibau aajakajui . Nuigtushkam kuashtai dita umijakbau aidauk ; shikiká umutai , yajaa ekentai , yujumak inagku takatai jiju aidaushkam , nuigtú pegakshakam tuke nijasjumké atajum tibau asamtai .

text: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him , Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders , but eat bread with unwashen hands ?
text2: Fariseo nuigtú chicham umiktinun jintinkagtin aidaujai Jisusan jegaantag : — ¿ Wagka amina jintintaijum aidaush , iina muunji umiktajum tusa tibauwa nuna umitskesh ikigmatskesh yuwinawa ?

text: He answered and said unto them , Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites , as it is written , This people honoureth me with their lips , but their heart is far from me .
text2: Tama ni ayaak : — Aentsú tsanú aidauwah , Apajuin etsegtin Isaías atumin pachis agak : ‘ Ju aents aina juka , minak dekas ditá anentain eme anenjuinak adaituinatsui , ayatak wenin adaituinawai .

text: Howbeit in vain do they worship me , teaching for doctines the commandments of men .
text2: Nuniau asag , mina pachittsag auna emematjai tujutuinawai ; jintinkagtuinakush , aents umiktajum tibauwa nuna jintinkagtuinak Apajuinu jintinkagtaji ’ , tuinawai .

text: For laying aside the commandment of God , ye hold the tradition of men , as the washing of pots and cups : and many other such like things ye do .
text2: — Atumek dekas Apajuí chicham umiktajum tibaujiya duka umigtsuk , aents tibauwa nu umiajume . Umutai yajá ekentai , vaso nijakjum nuigtushkam tikich kuashat jumamtin aidau taká yujajume .

text: And he said unto them , Full well ye reject the commandment of God , that ye may keep your own tradition .
text2: Nuigtushkam Apajuí chicham umiktajum tujabauwa duka imanchauch emakjum , atum chicham najanamua nu umiagme .

text: For Moses said , Honour thy father and thy mother ; and , Whoso curseth father or mother , let him die the death :
text2: Nuniakjum Moisés chichaak : ‘ Atumin apa dukujai eme anentsá diitajum , dutikakjum yaigtajum ; untsu ni apajin , dukujinakesh pegkegchaun chichajuk tsagkugtsuk maatajum ’ , tibauwai .

text: But ye say , If a man shall say to his father or mother , It is Corban , that is to say , a gift , by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me ; he shall be free .
text2: Tibau aig atum chichaakjum : ‘ Aentsuk ni apajinak , ni dukujinakesh : Mina wají ajutaina juka corbagkai , nuniau asamtai yaimaitsujame tumainai ’ tajume . ( Corbán tawa duka : “ Apajuí anentag anagkuamu ” , taku tawai )

text: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother ;
text2: Atumek nuna aatus tauk apajinak , dukujinakesh yaimaitsui , tajume .

text: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition , which ye have delivered : and many such like things do ye .
text2: Ju aatsa tau asajum , Apajuí chicham umiktajum timawa duka imanchauch emajum idaikujum , atumi muunjum umiktajum tibauwa duke wejakjum tikich jumamtuk aina dushakam takaagme , — tiuwai .

text: And when he had called all the people unto him , he said unto them , Hearken unto me every one of you , and understand :
text2: Juna ti aents aidaun untsuká chichaak : — Wi taja ju shiig antugtuktajum :

text: There is nothing from without a man , that entering into him can defile him : but the things which come out of him , those are they that defile the man .
text2: Aentsú wenin agaaya wayaa duka makichkish aentsnak pegkegchau emamainuk atsawai ; untsu anentainmaya jiina nuuwai aentsun pegkegchau emauk .

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Ni antutaiji ajamuk antuktinme , — tiuwai .

text: And when he was entered into the house from the people , his disciples asked him concerning the parable .
text2: Nuna tusa aents aidaun ukuak jegá wayamtai , niina jintintaiji aidau nu augmatbaun pachisag iniidau .

text: And he saith unto them , Are ye so without understanding also ? Do ye not perceive , that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man , it cannot defile him ;
text2: Tama ni ayaak : — ¿ Atumesh tikich shiig antuinatsu antsagmekek antuinatsjum ? Ashí agaaya wayaa duka aentsnak pegkegchauk emamaitsui ,

text: Because it entereth not into his heart , but into the belly , and goeth out into the draught , purging all meats ?
text2: anentainum waitsuk , ampugnumag egkemag letrinanum ajapnau asa . Junak ashí yutaig pegkeg ainawai tusa tiuwai . Nuigtushkam :

text: And he said , That which cometh out of the man , that defileth the man .
text2: — Aentsú anentain jiina nu aentsnak pegkegchau emawai .

text: For from within , out of the heart of men , proceed evil thoughts , adulteries , fornications , murders ,
text2: Duka aentsú anentainia jiinui pegkegchau anentaimat , pegkegchau takastasa wakegamu , magkagtamushkam ,

text: Thefts , covetousness , wickedness , deceit , lasciviousness , an evil eye , blasphemy , pride , foolishness :
text2: tsanijinbau , kasabau aidau , sujimamu , pegkegchau ata , tsanubau , nuwajai shiig senchi takanistasa wakegat , tikichdau diigsá kajejut , yumigmamu , ememamushkam , anentainkas takamat aina dushakam .

text: All these evil things come from within , and defile the man .
text2: Ju ashí pegkegchau aina duka anentainmaya jiinui , nuniau asa aentsnak pegkegchau emawai , — tiuwai .

text: And from thence he arose , and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon , and entered into an house , and would have no man know it : but he could not be hid .
text2: Nuwiya jiinki Tiro nugkanum , Sidón nugkanmashkam weuwai . Nunik makichik aentskesh dekajuawainum tau asa jeganum wayau , tujash uumainchau dekapjau .

text: For a certain woman , whose young daughter had an unclean spirit , heard of him , and came and fell at his feet :
text2: Nuniai nuwa nawanji wakan pegkegchau egkemtugbau antuku nui pujawai tabaun , nunik tajuntun tikishmatjau .

text: The woman was a Greek , a Syrophenician by nation ; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter .
text2: Duka nuwak griega Sirofenicianmaya aajakuí , nunú segau : — Nawantug wakan pegkegchau egkemtugbauwa nu jigtugkita , — tusa .

text: But Jesus said unto her , Let the children first be filled : for it is not meet to take the children ' s bread , and to cast it unto the dogs .
text2: Tujash Jisus ayaak : — Jasta , dekatkauk Israela uchijí aidauwá yuwatnume , pag uchi yuwamu atankí yawá suwamuk pegkegchauwai .

text: And she answered and said unto him , Yes , Lord : yet the dogs under the table eat of the children ' s crumbs .
text2: Tama nuwa ayaak : — Ehé dekaske Apuh , tujash yawashkam mesa wapken pujusá uchi yujumak akakeamun yuwame , — tau .

text: And he said unto her , For this saying go thy way ; the devil is gone out of thy daughter .
text2: Tama ni ayaak : — Nunú tame duwik wetá . wakan pegkegchauk nawanjumnak jiinki ukukne , — tau .

text: And when she was come to her house , she found the devil gone out , and her daughter laid upon the bed .
text2: Tima nuwashkam wakitki jeen jegakmá , nawanji wakan pegkegchau egkemtuamunak agkan wajas pegaknum tepettaman wainkauwai .

text: And again , departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon , he came unto the sea of Galilee , through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis .
text2: Jisus Tiro nugkanum pujau jinki Sidón nagkaemak , Galilea kuchajin jegauwai .

text: And they bring unto him one that was deaf , and had an impediment in his speech ; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him .
text2: Nunikmatai aents empekú dewaun itaantaju , dutikawag : — Uwegmin achigtukta , — tusag segaidau .

text: And he took him aside from the multitude , and put his fingers into his ears , and he spit , and touched his tongue ;
text2: Tiagtai Jisus aents nuninun akanak juki , ni tsajam uwejen kuwishin inujuauwai ; dutika usukin juki nuna inayin antinkauwai .

text: And looking up to heaven , he sighed , and saith unto him , Ephphatha , that is , Be opened .
text2: Dutika wajan nayaimpinum pagkai mayatak : “ Éfata ” , tau . ( Nunak “ ujanta ” taku tiuwai . )

text: And straightway his ears were opened , and the string of his tongue was loosed , and he spake plain .
text2: Tusa tamawaik aents antuchun kuwishig ujaniuwai , inayishkam pegkeg wajasuí , nunikmatai shiig chichakú .

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man : but the more he charged them , so much the more a great deal they published it ;
text2: Dutika : — Makichik aentskesh ujakaigpajum , — tiuwai . Tusa tibau ainayatak nuní senchi etsegtuidau .

text: And were beyond measure astonished , saying , He hath done all things well : he maketh both the deaf to hear , and the dumb to speak .
text2: Imatjiagtai shiig puyatjusag : “ Ashí dekas pegkejan takaawai , empekunash antumtikawai , chichachunash chichamtikawai ” , tuidau .

text: In those days the multitude being very great , and having nothing to eat , Jesus called his disciples unto him , and saith unto them ,
text2: Nunú tsawantinig kuashat aents tuwakaju asag , yumainji atsujuidau asagmatai , Jisus ni jintintaiji aidaun untsuká ijumag :

text: I have compassion on the multitude , because they have now been with me three days , and have nothing to eat :
text2: — Ju aents aidaun wait anentuinajai , juwi wijai kampatum tsawantai yujumkanash yutsuk batsataina duwi ,

text: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses , they will faint by the way : for divers of them came from far .
text2: wi yujumkan ayugtsuk ishiakmak , jeen jegatakamá pimpikiag jaka iyaumain ainawai , dita atushtanmaya kaunkajush aina duwi , — tau .

text: And his disciples answered him , From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness ?
text2: Tutai niina jintintaiji aidau aiinak : — ¿ Tuwiya jutiish aents atsamunum pujag juniautish jusha ajamsagtatji ?

text: And he asked them , How many loaves have ye ? And they said , Seven .
text2: Tiagtai ditan iniak : — ¿ Wajupa pagka ajutjamainawa ? Tama : — Siete pag ajutjamui , — tuidau .

text: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground : and he took the seven loaves , and gave thanks , and brake , and gave to his disciples to set before them ; and they did set them before the people .
text2: Tiagtai : — Aents nugkanum batsagtajum — tusa ishiaku . Dutika ashí umikagmatai pagkan juki , Apajuin see tusa puujá ni jintintaiji aidaun tinabiu , dita aentsú susatnume tusa . Dutikam ditashkam aentsun tinamkaju .

text: And they had a few small fishes : and he blessed , and commanded to set them also before them .
text2: Namakshakam ujumchik au asamtai , dutiksag Apajin aujus nunashkam tinamkagtitajum tusa tinabiu .

text: So they did eat , and were filled : and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets .
text2: Dutikawajam yuwawag shiig ejemakaju . Nunikagmatai pag mamayakjai ampinkaun siete chagkinnum aimjajui .

text: And they that had eaten were about four thousand : and he sent them away .
text2: Nuna yuwawajua duka cuatro mil aents tumain aajakajui . Imanun ayujuk akatek ishiakui .

text: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples , and came into the parts of Dalmanutha .
text2: Dutika ukukí , ni jintintaiji aidaujai botenum chimpimag Dalmanuta nugkanum weuwai .

text: And the Pharisees came forth , and began to question with him , seeking of him a sign from heaven , tempting him .
text2: Nui jegamtai fariseo aidau kautuawag , Jisusjai kuashat tudayinau . Nuninak dekas Apajuí uchijimpashit tusag dekapsatatus : — Nayaimpinmaya wainchatai iwainkagtukia , — tuidau .

text: And he sighed deeply in his spirit , and saith , Why doth this generation seek after a sign ? verily I say unto you , There shall no sign be given unto this generation .
text2: Tusá segainam Jisus senchi mayati wajan chichaak : — ¿ Wagka atum wegantutigmesh wainchatai iwainkagtukia tusagmesh tuké tajume ? Dekas tajime : Atumnak makichik iwainamunakesh iwaintukchattajime .

text: And he left them , and entering into the ship again departed to the other side .
text2: Tusa ukuak botenum egkemag , ataktú amain katigkuí .

text: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread , neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf .
text2: Nui weenak pagkan kajimatkiag jukichaju asag yumainjig atsujuidau , nuninayatak makichik pagkan takus weedau .

text: And he charged them , saying , Take heed , beware of the leaven of the Pharisees , and of the leaven of Herod .
text2: Nuniku asagmatai Jisus : — Nijah , fariseo aidau , nuigtú Herodesa levaduraji aina nujai kuitamamkatajum , — tau .

text: And they reasoned among themselves , saying , It is because we have no bread .
text2: Tutai ditak pempeentunikiag : “ Junak ii pag takukchajag duwi tujamji ” , tuidau .

text: And when Jesus knew it , he saith unto them , Why reason ye , because ye have no bread ? perceive ye not yet , neither understand ? have ye your heart yet hardened ?
text2: Nu tuinamun Jisus dekajua : — ¿ Wagka pag pachisjumesh jiyaniagme ? ¿ Atumek dekamainchau dekapeau asagmek utujimsajum anentaimjum ?

text: Having eyes , see ye not ? and having ears , hear ye not ? and do ye not remember ?
text2: ¿ Atumek jime ajutjamainaigkik , wainmachu wajukmaina numamtuk wajakjum , antayatkugmesh antuchu wajukmaina numamtuk wajajum ? ¿ Nuniau asagmek aneaktsujum ?

text: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? They say unto him , Twelve .
text2: Wi jimagchik paagkai cinco mil aents ayugkamash ¿ wajupa chagkina aimkamiugme ampinjau aidaush ? Tama dita aiinak : — Doce , — tiaju .

text: And when the seven among four thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? And they said , Seven .
text2: Tiagtai : — Wi siete pagkan jukin cuatro mil aents ayugkamash ¿ wajupa chagkina aimkamiugme ampinkau aidaush ? Tama dita aiinak : — Siete aimjamiaji , — tuidau .

text: And he said unto them , How is it that ye do not understand ?
text2: Tutai ni ayaak : — ¿ Dutikau ayatkugmek dekamainchau dekapeajum ?

text: And he cometh to Bethsaida ; and they bring a blind man unto him , and besought him to touch him .
text2: Nuna ti Betsaida jegauwai . Nunikmatai wainmachun itajiag , antinjukta tusa segaidau .

text: And he took the blind man by the hand , and led him out of the town ; and when he had spit on his eyes , and put his hands upon him , he asked him if he saw ought .
text2: Tama Jisuschakam wainmachun egkesá juki , yaaktauchin ukumtiki jiin usuktua , uwejen nuna jiin patatiu , dutika : — ¿ Machikish wainmatsmek ? — tusa iniasu .

text: And he looked up , and said , I see men as trees , walking .
text2: Tama niimak : — Aents aidaunak tuke numia nuninun wainjai ; tujash weedaun , — tau .

text: After that he put his hands again upon his eyes , and made him look up : and he was restored , and saw every man clearly .
text2: Tutai Jisus wainmachu jiin ataktú uwejen patatiu , dutikam shiig esetug niimi pegkeg wajasú , nunik atushtanmayanash shiig paan wainkau .

text: And he sent him away to his house , saying , Neither go into the town , nor tell it to any in the town .
text2: Nunikmatai ni jeen awebau , dutikak : — Yaaktanmak wayawaipa , makichik aentskesh ujakaipa , — tiu .

text: And Jesus went out , and his disciples , into the towns of Caesarea Philippi : and by the way he asked his disciples , saying unto them , Whom do men say that I am ?
text2: Jisus nuna dutika niina jintintaiji aidaujai yaakat Cesarea , Filipo tutaya nuanuí yaakta ukukí batsamin aidaunum wegajui . Nunik jintá wesa ni jintintaiji aidaun iniak : — ¿ Aents aidaush minash yaayai tujutuinawa ? — tau .

text: And they answered , John the Baptist : but some say , Elias ; and others , One of the prophets .
text2: Tutai dita aiinak : — Wajumak aents aidau : ‘ Juan Yamijatin maamua nuuwai ’ tujamainai , tikich chichaidau : ‘ Auk Eliasai ’ tujamainai , tikich tuidau : ‘ Apajuí etsegtin aajakajua dutsukaitai ’ tujamainawai , — tuidau .

text: And he saith unto them , But whom say ye that I am ? And Peter answereth and saith unto him , Thou art the Christ .
text2: Tiagtai ni ayaak : — ¿ Tujash atumesh , minash yaayai tujutjume ? — tau . Tutai Pedro ayaak : — Amek Kristuitme , — tiu .

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him .
text2: — Tujash mina pachittsagmek makichik aentskesh ujakaigpajum , — tiuwai .

text: And he began to teach them , that the Son of man must suffer many things , and be rejected of the elders , and of the chief priests , and scribes , and be killed , and after three days rise again .
text2: Nuna ti nagkama jintintak : “ Wi Apajuí Uchijiyaitkun Aentsmaga Akiinauwaitag nunak senchi waitkagsagtatui , apu aidau , sacerdote apuji aidaush , chicham umiktinun jintinkagtin aidaushkam dakitjuinak mantuawagtatui . Dutijuawagmataish kampatum tsawan asan nantaktatjai ” , tusa etsegkauwai .

text: And he spake that saying openly . And Peter took him , and began to rebuke him .
text2: Nuna tusa paan etsegtai , Pedro akanak juki kakaakan chichajak : — ¿ Wagka amesh annush anentaime ? — tiuwai .

text: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples , he rebuked Peter , saying , Get thee behind me , Satan : for thou savourest not the things that be of God , but the things that be of men .
text2: Tama ni jintintaiji aidaun ayampattsag diyak Pedron jiyaak : — ¡ Wetá iwanchih , minai tantá wajatsuk ! Amek dekatsme Apajuí dutikatjai tabaujiya duka , aentsú anentaimtaig anentaimam duwi , — tiuwai .

text: And when he had called the people unto him with his disciples also , he said unto them , Whosoever will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross , and follow me .
text2: Nunik ni jintintaiji aidaun , nuigtú tikich aents aidaujai untsuk ijumag chichajak : — Mina nemagtuktasajum wakegautigmek , atum wakegamuk idaikujum nemagtuktajum , nuniakjum senchi waitiakjumesh atsanjatajum .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it ; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel ' s , the same shall save it .
text2: Ashí aents ju nugka juwi pujutan imá senchi wakegak , mina nemagtuk waittan dakitauk uwemjashtin ainawai . Untsu ashí aents mina nemagtuk pujus , nuigtú yamajam chichaman etsejak pujus jaina nu uwemjagtin ainawai .

text: For what shall it profit a man , if he shall gain the whole world , and lose his own soul ?
text2: Aents ju nugka juwiya wají aidaun , ashí niinu emakush jaakug niina wakaninak tuké uwemtikmaitsui .

text: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul ?
text2: Aentsuk ni wakaní uwemtijatasa akikmatmainjig atsawai .

text: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation ; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed , when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels .
text2: Atum mina pachittsa chichat datsamakjum , chichamjushkam datsantakjum aents mina dekaskeapi tujutchau aidau , Apajuí chichame umijuinatsu dushakam ujakchau aidautigminak , wi Apajuí Uchijiyaitkun Aentsmagan Akiinauwaitag nuna , mina Apajú tsaaptinjijai tsawan wajasan nayaimpinmaya aents pegkejam aidaujai minaknushkam : Juka midauchu ainawai , titinaitjime .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , That there be some of them that stand here , which shall not taste of death , till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power .
text2: Nuigtushkam : — Dekas tajime : Atum juwi ijunjum juwiyatijum wajumak aidautijum eke jatsuk iwaaku pujusjumek , Apajuí inamtaiji senchijijai minau wainkatnutigmesh ajume , — tiuwai .

text: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter , and James , and John , and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves : and he was transfigured before them .
text2: Seis tsawan asa Jisus , Pedron , Jacobon , nuigtú Juagkan juki ditanak akanki muja yakí tsakajunum wegajui . Nui ditash wainainaig Jisusa niimé yapajinauwai .

text: And his raiment became shining , exceeding white as snow ; so as no fuller on earth can white them .
text2: Niina jaanchjig winchamtin shiig puju nieve tutaiya iman wajasuí , ju nugka juwiya aents jaanchin senchi nijakush imatika puju emamainchau aajakuí .

text: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses : and they were talking with Jesus .
text2: Nuniaig Moisés , Eliasjai Jisusan aujuidaun wainkajui .

text: And Peter answered and said to Jesus , Master , it is good for us to be here : and let us make three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias .
text2: Nunik Pedro Jisusan chichajak : — Jintinkagtinuh , jutiish maigkis juwig batsatagtai , kampatum aak aakmagmi . Makichik aminu , tikich Moisesdau , nuigtú Eliasdau , — tau .

text: For he wist not what to say ; for they were sore afraid .
text2: Nunak ni tabaujinakesh dekachiatak senchi ishamkamunum , tiuwai .

text: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them : and a voice came out of the cloud , saying , This is my beloved Son : hear him .
text2: Nuna taig yujagkim ijikuí . Nuniaig yujagminmaya chichaak : “ Juuwai dekas mina uchig anetaijuk , nigki antugkujum umigkatajum ” , tabaun antukajui .

text: And suddenly , when they had looked round about , they saw no man any more , save Jesus only with themselves .
text2: Nuna timatai diikmá imá Jisusnak wainkajui .

text: And as they came down from the mountain , he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen , till the Son of man were risen from the dead .
text2: Nunik mujanmaya minisá : — Atum wainkaujum nu pachisjumek makichik aentskesh ujakaigpajum , wi Apajuí Uchijiyaitkun Aentsmaga Akiinauwaitag nuna mantuawagmatai nantatsaigkik , — tiu .

text: And they kept that saying with themselves , questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean .
text2: Tusa tiajam pachitsuk idaisajui . Nuninayatak , jakau ayatkun nantaktinaitjai , tawa nunash wajukatnunak tawa tusag iniinidau .

text: And they asked him , saying , Why say the scribes that Elias must first come ?
text2: Nuninak : — ¿ Wagka chicham umiktinun jintinkagtin aidaush , dekatkauk Eliasá taatnai tuinawa ?

text: And he answered and told them , Elias verily cometh first , and restoreth all things ; and how it is written of the Son of man , that he must suffer many things , and be set at nought .
text2: Tiagtai Jisus ayaak : — Eliasak niiyá eemak taatnai nunik tikich takastinun umiktinai tibauwa duka dekaske . Tujash ¿ wajintu agagbauwaita Apajuí Uchijiyaitak Aentsmaga Akiinatnun pachisash , senchi waittsatnai nuigtush dakitjamu atinai tatsuak ?

text: But I say unto you , That Elias is indeed come , and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed , as it is written of him .
text2: Tujash wi tajime : Eliasak taabi , nunikmataish dita pegkegchau takaamujinak dutiksag inagkeatkiagmayi . Agagbaunum niina pachis tawa dutiksajag , — tiu .

text: And when he came to his disciples , he saw a great multitude about them , and the scribes questioning with them .
text2: Nunik ni jintintaiji aidau batsatbaunum jegakmá wainkaju kuashat aents tuwajuk aun , tuja chicham umiktinun jintinkagtinchakam ditajai tudayinaun .

text: And straightway all the people , when they beheld him , were greatly amazed , and running to him saluted him .
text2: Nunidau Jisusan wainkag puyatuk tupikatkiag jegaantag kumpamawajui .

text: And he asked the scribes , What question ye with them ?
text2: Nunikmatai ditan iniak : — ¿ Wají pachisjumea ditajaish tudaijume ? — tau .

text: And one of the multitude answered and said , Master , I have brought unto thee my son , which hath a dumb spirit ;
text2: Tutai aents tuwakbaunmaya makichik ayaak : — Jintinkagtinuh , mina uchijun wakan pegkegchau egkemtua chichachu etugtimun amina itajuagme .

text: And wheresoever he taketh him , he teareth him : and he foameth , and gnasheth with his teeth , and pineth away : and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out ; and they could not .
text2: Juka wakan egkemtamak kujaak , saun kaput apak , nain takegtak , ichichkam patamnuwe . Imatijutin asamtai amina jintintaijum aidaun , jiigtugkitajum timajai , tujash tujinkagmae , — tau .

text: He answereth him , and saith , O faithless generation , how long shall I be with you ? how long shall I suffer you ? bring him unto me .
text2: Tutai Jisus ayaak : — ¡ Aents dekaskeapi tuchau aidauwah ! ¿ Wajupá dukapea atumjai ijunjanush pujumainaitja ? ¿ wajupá dukapek dakastajime minak dekaskeapi tujuttinme tusanush ? — Nuna ti : — ¡ Itantá ! — tiuwai .

text: And they brought him unto him : and when he saw him , straightway the spirit tare him ; and he fell on the ground , and wallowed foaming .
text2: Timatai uchin ejentuntaju . Dutiktai wakan nunú uchin egkemtaushkam Jisusan wainak uchinak waugmitkaku , dutikam nugká iyaag tanagak saunak kaput apakú .

text: And he asked his father , How long is it ago since this came unto him ? And he said , Of a child .
text2: Imatiktai Jisus uchí apajin iniak : — ¿ Wajupa tsawantaiya junash imatiká pujugnaita ? — tau . Tama : — Uchuch aig nagkamauwai .

text: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire , and into the waters , to destroy him : but if thou canst do any thing , have compassion on us , and help us .
text2: Dutikau asa jinumash jiyata tinuwe , namakash ajug maata tinuwe . Ame machikiuchikesh dutikmainaitkumek wait anenkagtujam jutiish yaijatkata , — tau .

text: Jesus said unto him , If thou canst believe , all things are possible to him that believeth .
text2: Tutai Jisus ayaak : — Dutikmainaitkumek tiipa ; aents dekaskeapi tauk ashí dutikmainai , — tiu .

text: And straightway the father of the child cried out , and said with tears , Lord , I believe ; help thou mine unbelief .
text2: Nuna taig uchí apajishkam senchi untsumak : — ¡ Dekaskeapi tajai ! ¡ Wi dekaskeapi tumain dekapeachkuish yainkata ! — tiu .

text: When Jesus saw that the people came running together , he rebuked the foul spirit , saying unto him , Thou dumb and deaf spirit , I charge thee , come out of him , and enter no more into him .
text2: Jisus kuashat aents tuwagtai wainak , wakan pegkegchaun jiyaak : — Wakan chichachu empekuwah , wi tajame : ¡ Jiinkim ukuktá , ataktuk waketjukmek egkemtuawaipa ! — tiu .

text: And the spirit cried , and rent him sore , and came out of him : and he was as one dead ; insomuch that many said , He is dead .
text2: Tama wakanchakam senchi untsumak uchin kujamtikak waamak jiinkiuwai , nunikmatai uchik jaka iyaantu . Nunitai kuashat aents chichainak : — Uchik jakae , — tuidau .

text: But Jesus took him by the hand , and lifted him up ; and he arose .
text2: Tujash Jisus uwegnum achiká inankiu , dutikam wajantú .

text: And when he was come into the house , his disciples asked him privately , Why could not we cast him out ?
text2: Nuna dutika Jisus jegá wayamtai , ni jintintaiji aidau agkan niinak iniinak : — ¿ Wagka jutiish jiiktakamaish tujinkamji ? — tuidau .

text: And he said unto them , This kind can come forth by nothing , but by prayer and fasting .
text2: Tiagtai ni ayaak : — Ju wakania juka makichkish kakajus jiimaitsui , Apajuí aujku yujumak ijagmaka pujachkuik , — tiu .

text: And they departed thence , and passed through Galilee ; and he would not that any man should know it .
text2: Nuwiya jiinki Galilea wegamun makichik aentskesh dekawainum tusa Jisus dakitau ,

text: For he taught his disciples , and said unto them , The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men , and they shall kill him ; and after that he is killed , he shall rise the third day .
text2: niina jintintaiji aidaun jintintuata tau asa . Nunik jintintak tau : — Apajuí Uchijiyaitak Aentsmaga Akiinauwa nunak , tikich aents aidaunum sujukag idaisagtatui , dutikawagmatai maawagtatui . Tujash jakaashkam kampatum tsawanta juwi nantaktatui , — tau .

text: But they understood not that saying , and were afraid to ask him .
text2: Tutaish ditak nuna takumpap tawa tusag dekamain dekapenachu . Nuninakush ajantuidau asag iniaschajui .

text: And he came to Capernaum : and being in the house he asked them , What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way ?
