text2: Nui nagkaemakiag botenum egkemawag Antioquía wegajui , nuwiya aidau yama nagkamchak Pablon Bernabejai , Jisusa chichame etsegkatajum tusa awemainak Apajuin aujtusajua nui , takatan ashimkag jegawajui .

text: And when they were come , and had gathered the church together , they rehearsed all that God had done with them , and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles .
text2: Nunik Antioquía jegawag , ashí Jisusa nemajin aidaun ijumag , Apajuí dita takainamunum shiig kuashat yaigkagbaun pachis ujakaju , judiuchu aidaush wajuk Apajuin dekaskeapi tiaje nunashkam .

text: And there they abode long time with the disciples .
text2: Nunikag Pablo Bernabejai kuashat tsawantai nuwig Jisusa nemajin aidaujai ijunag batsamsajui .

text: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren , and said , Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Nunú tsawantai wajumak Judeanmaya aidau Antioquía jegawag , Jisusa nemajin aidaun jintintuinak : “ Atumek Moisés chicham umiktinun agajua nui , pakamaktajum tibauwa nu umiachkugmek uweemain ainatsjume ” , tuidau .

text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them , they determined that Paul and Barnabas , and certain other of them , should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question .
text2: Tuinamun Pablo Bernabejai antukag , ditajai senchi pampandaijajui . Nu aatus au asamtai Antioquianmaya aidau : Pablon , Bernaben , nuigtú tikich Jisusa nemajin aidaujai etejajui Jerusalén wetinme , nunikag nunú yaaktanum Jisus chicham etsegtugkatajum tusa etegjamu aidau , nuigtú Jisusa nemajuidaun diin batsata nujai , nuna pachisag chichastinme tau asag .

text: And being brought on their way by the church , they passed through Phenice and Samaria , declaring the conversion of the Gentiles : and they caused great joy unto all the brethren .
text2: Dutika awemajam , Fenicia nugkanum tuja Samaria nugkanmashkam nagkaemainak : “ Yamaik judiuchu aents aidaushkam duwik umitaijinak idayinak Apajuin nemajuinawai ” , tusa etsejiagtai ashí Jisusa nemajin antukag shiig aneedau .

text: And when they were come to Jerusalem , they were received of the church , and of the apostles and elders , and they declared all things that God had done with them .
text2: Pablo Bernabejai Jerusalén jegawagmatai Jisusa nemajin aidau , Jisus chicham etsegtugkatajum tusa etegjamu aidaujai , Jisusa nemajuidaun diin aidaushkam shiig anentus jukiajui , dutikawajam ditashkam Apajuí yayasam dita takasbaujinak imatiksag ditanash ujaidau .

text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed , saying , That it was needful to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the law of Moses .
text2: Tiagtai wajumak fariseo aidau , Jisusan dekaskeapi tusag nemagkaju aidau wajaidiag chichainak : — Dekas judiuchu aidau Jisusa nemajuina dushakam , Moisés chicham umiktajum tibauwa nunash umiktinme nuninak pakamamain ainawai , — tuidau .

text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter .
text2: Tuidau asagmatai Jisus chicham etsegtugkatajum tusa etegjamu aidau , Jisusa nemajuidaun diin aidaujai ijunjaju : Dusha dekas wajuk amainkita , tusag dekawagtatus .

text: And when there had been much disputing , Peter rose up , and said unto them , Men and brethren , ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us , that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel , and believe .
text2: Kuashat nuna pachisag chichá chichamjamunum , Pedro wajakí chichaak : — Yatsug aidauh , atumek shiig dekagme , Apajuí atum ainajum anuiyatigmin mina etegtuauwa duka , aents judiuchu aidaunash yamajam chicham uwemta nuna pachis etsegtai antukag , ditashkam Jisusan dekaskeapi titinme tujutu asa .

text: And God , which knoweth the hearts , bare them witness , giving them the Holy Ghost , even as he did unto us ;
text2: Apajuí anentaibaunash ashí dekauwa nunú , wi ditanash uwemtijatasan wakegag nunash dekaatnume tau asa , jutiin Wakaní Pegkejin sujamsagmaya dutiksag ditanash Wakaní Pegkejin egketjagmayi .

text: And put no difference between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
text2: Apajuik jutiinash , tikich judiuchu aina nunashkam , ditash aentsua nunin diigmatsuk , ashí betek Jisusaig kajinas anentaibiagtai , ditá anentainash pegkemtikiajui .

text: Now therefore why tempt ye God , to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
text2: Nunin aish ¿ wagka atumesh dusha Apajuí ekajmainush , iina muunji aidaukesh umikchaju , yamaikish jutiish umimainchauwa dusha , Jisusa nemajin aidau umiktinme tusagmesh wakegagme ?

text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved , even as they .
text2: Duka nuninchauwai , yamaik jutii Apu Jisus dekaskeapi tabaunum uwemainag nunisag ditashkam uwemainawai , — tiuwai .

text: Then all the multitude kept silence , and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul , declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them .
text2: Timatai ashí itatjag Bernabé , Pablojai Apajuí yayasam aents dutikmainchaun , judiuchu aidaunmash iwainagbaun etsejiagtai , ekeemsag antú pekajuidau .

text: And after they had held their peace , James answered , saying , Men and brethren , hearken unto me :
text2: Chichaamun ashimkagmatai Jacobo wajakí chichaak : — Yatsug aidauh , minash antugtuktajum .

text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
text2: Apajuí wajuk judiuchu aidaunash yamaik wait anentug , mina aentsug agtinme tusag etegjae , nuna pachis Simón ujapakaje .

text: And to this agree the words of the prophets ; as it is written ,
text2: Nunak Apajuí etsegtin agagbauwa nujai betek nunikaje , nu agagbaunmag Apajuí chichaak :

text: After this I will return , and will build again the tabernacle of David , which is fallen down ; and I will build again the ruins thereof , and I will set it up :
text2: ‘ Ju junikmatai wi David wegantu aidau jega tegaekauwa numamtuk wajakaja nuna , ataktú jegamaina numamtuk awajkattajai , agkan batsamsatnume tusan .

text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord , and all the Gentiles , upon whom my name is called , saith the Lord , who doeth all these things .
text2: Dutikam ashí tikich nugkanmaya aidaush imá minak egatuinak , mina aentsug aina nujai betek agtinme tau asan , tiuwai .

text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world .
text2: Apu Apajuí yaunchuk nagkamas jujú chichaman dekamtijamauwa nu yamaish aatus tawai . ’

text: Wherefore my sentence is , that we trouble not them , which from among the Gentiles are turned to God :
text2: “ Nuaduí wika aents judiuchuitak , Apajuin nemagkaja duka ju dutikatajum tusaik waitkaschagmi tajai .

text: But that we write unto them , that they abstain from pollutions of idols , and from fornication , and from things strangled , and from blood .
text2: Dekas ayatak papí agatjagmi : Ashí apajimtai aidau anagkuamu aina duka yuwawaigpajum , tsanijimtash tsanijinawaigpajum , kuntin ayatak pempeaja maamu aina nuna nejesh , kuntin ayatak jakau aina nuna nejeshkam , numpashkam yuwawaigpajum , tusa duke tiagmi .

text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him , being read in the synagogues every sabbath day .
text2: Yaunchuk nagkamas awai ashí yaaktanum Moisés chicham umiktajum tusa agagbauwa nuna etsejuidauk , duka tsawan ayamtai tsawagmatai jega ijuntainum tuke aujtayai ” , — tiuwai .

text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders , with the whole church , to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas ; namely , Judas surnamed Barsabas , and Silas , chief men among the brethren :
text2: Tutai Jisus chicham etsegtugkatajum tusa etegjamu aidau , Jisusa nemajuidaun diin aidaujai , ashí Jisusa nemajin aidaujaishkam shiig chichasag dita aina nuwiyan , Pablo Bernabejai Antioquianum wegagtai awemagtatus etegjajui . Dutikainak Judas tikich daaji Barsabás tutaya nuna Silasjai etegkawajui , nunú aina nui dekas eme anentsá diitai aidaun ,

text: And they wrote letters by them after this manner ; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia :
text2: Dita wegagtai papiin agatuinak : “ Jutii dekas Jisus chicham etsegtugkatajum tusa etegjamu aidauti , Jisusa nemajuidaun diin aina nujai ijuntsan , atum Jisusa nemajin aidautijum judiuchu Antioquía , Siria nugkanum , Cilicia nugka aina nuwish batsatainajum nunú aidautigminash shiig anentsan kumpamjime .

text: Forasmuch as we have heard , that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words , subverting your souls , saying , Ye must be circumcised , and keep the law : to whom we gave no such commandment :
text2: Wajumak aents juajuiya , jutii wetá tichamaitak atumiin midiag tajutjamawag , anentaimtagminish pachimjamkag ukugmakiaju tabau dekaamji .

text: It seemed good unto us , being assembled with one accord , to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
text2: Nunikaja ashí ijunja chichasá , jimag aents etegka , jutii aneetaiji yatsug Bernabé , Pablojai anuí atumin ijagtamsatatus mininakui awemainaji .

text: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Bernabé , Pablo aina juka , ditak Apu Jisukristu chichamen etsejuidau asag , maata tuinamash ditá pujutjinak puyatjuinatsui .

text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas , who shall also tell you the same things by mouth .
text2: Dita mininakui Judasan , Silasjai awetajime , dita anuí tajutjamawag shiig igkumpasag , ashí juna pachisajag ujapaktinme .

text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things ;
text2: Wakaní Pegkejiya duka atumnak atum umikchamna imannak tujamtsugme , jutiishakam aikasaik anentaimtuidau asaja ayatak :

text: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols , and from blood , and from things strangled , and from fornication : from which if ye keep yourselves , ye shall do well . Fare ye well .
text2: Ashí apajimtai aidau anagkuamu aina duka yuwawaigpajum , tsanijintash tsanijinawaigpajum , kuntin ayatak pempeaja maamu aina nuna nejesh , kuntin ayatak jakau aina nuna nejeshkam , numpashkam yuwawaigpajum tusa tajime . Jujú aina nujai kuitamamkugmek shiig imagnisjum pujuttagme . ”

text: So when they were dismissed , they came to Antioch : and when they had gathered the multitude together , they delivered the epistle :
text2: Jujú aatsa agatja susam sujuktatus Antioquianum wegajui . Nunikag jegawag ashí aentsun ijumjag , nunú papí agagbaun susajui .

text: Which when they had read , they rejoiced for the consolation .
text2: Dutikawajam Jisusa nemajin aidau nuna papí ausag dita tiagbaun antuinak , shiig senchi shiig aneasaju , anentai ichichtuinamu asag .

text: And Judas and Silas , being prophets also themselves , exhorted the brethren with many words , and confirmed them .
text2: Judas , Silas aina dushakam Apajuí etsegtin asag , nuwiya Jisusa nemajuidaunash ujaak , anentai ichichtujag wakemitkakaju .

text: And after they had tarried there a space , they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles .
text2: Nui dukap tsawan batsamsag Judas wakettai , Jisusa nemajin aidau shiig anentsag akateg awemajui .

text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still .
text2: Tujash Silasak kumpají waketiagtaish juwakui .

text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the Lord , with many others also .
text2: Pablok Bernabejaig Antioquiak juwakag , tikich aidaujai ijunjag Apu Jisusa pachis yamajam chichaman jintinkagtuidau .

text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas , Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord , and see how they do .
text2: Wajumak tsawan batsamsag Pablo Bernaben chichajak : — Ataktú Jisusan nemagkaju aidau ijagsami , ashí yaaktanum Apu Jisusa chichame etsegkabiag nui wajuk ditash batsatainawak nu diiyaku , — tiuwai .

text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: Nu tabaunum Bernabé , Juan tikich daaji Marcos tutaiya nuna ayatatus wakegau .

text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them , who departed from them from Pamphylia , and went not with them to the work .
text2: Tujash Pablok nunak ayamainchau dekapeau , wagki Marcosak Panfilianum ditan ukuak , ijunas takatnum wechau asamtai .

text: And the contention was so sharp between them , that they departed asunder one from the other : and so Barnabas took Mark , and sailed unto Cyprus ;
text2: Nunitai kuashat jiya jiyanituinakua mai kanakaju . Nunik Bernabek Marcosan juki Chiprenum weuwai .

text: And Paul chose Silas , and departed , being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God .
text2: Nuniai Pablok Silasan juki , Jisusa nemajin aidau : — Apu Jisus yaimpamunum wekaesatajum , — tusa shiig akatjajam , nuwiya jiinkiag ,

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the churches .
text2: Siria nugkanum , Cilicia nugkanmashkam Jisusan nemajuidaun anentain ichichtukiag nagkaemaidau .

text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra : and , behold , a certain disciple was there , named Timotheus , the son of a certain woman , which was a Jewess , and believed ; but his father was a Greek :
text2: Pablo yaakat Derbenum jegaa nagkaemaki Listranmashkam jegau . Nunikmá makichik datsauch Timoteo Jisusa nemagnun wainkau , nuna dukujig judío nuwa Apajuí nemajin , untsu apají griego aents aajakuí .

text: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium .
text2: Jisusa nemajuidau Listranum , Iconio batsataidauk , Timoteon pachisag pegkejan chichajuidau .

text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him ; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters : for they knew all that his father was a Greek .
text2: Tuidau asagmatai Pablo Timoteo uyuntusti tusa wakegau asa , pakaji ajapjuatajum tima pakajiajui , judío nui batsamin aidau pegkegchaun anentaimtinum tau asa , apají griegon ashí dekaidau asagmatai .

text: And as they went through the cities , they delivered them the decrees for to keep , that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem .
text2: Nunikag ashí yaaktanum nagkaemainak , Jisusa nemajin aidaun ujaidau , Jisus chicham etsegtugkatajum tusa etegjamu aidau , nuigtú Jisusa nemajuidaun diin aidau Jerusalén batsamas agagbaun pachisag .

text: And so were the churches established in the faith , and increased in number daily .
text2: Aatus nunidau asagmatai , Jisusa nemajin aidau dita kajintsá anentaibaujinish nuní nagkaemas ichichmamaidau , nuninak Jisusa nemajuidaushkam kashí kashinig ayatak kawedau .

text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia , and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia ,
text2: Wakaní Pegkejiya nunú Asia nugkanum etsegkatajum tusa awemashbau asag , Frigianum jegaa Galacia jegaashkam nagkaemakiag ,

text: After they were come to Mysia , they assayed to go into Bithynia : but the Spirit suffered them not .
text2: Misia nugkanum jegawag , Bitinia nugkanum wegagtatus anentaimaidau ; tujash Wakaní Pegkeji wetinme tusag idaisachui .

text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas .
text2: Nunikag Misianak tutupnik nagkaikiag Troas jegawajui .

text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night ; There stood a man of Macedonia , and prayed him , saying , Come over into Macedonia , and help us .
text2: Nunikag Pablo nui kintamtatman kashi paan Macedonianmaya aents wajantun : “ Juwi Macedonia katigkam minash jintinjuata ” , taun wainkauwai .

text: And after he had seen the vision , immediately we endeavored to go into Macedonia , assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them .
text2: Pablo nuna wainkamtai , dekas Macedonia wegagmi tusa umintsabiaji , junak Apajuiyap yamajam chichaman awi etsegkati tujamu asa jutikawa tusaja .

text: Therefore loosing from Troas , we came with a straight course to Samothracia , and the next day to Neapolis ;
text2: Nunikaja Troasnum egkemjá tutupnik wega wegakua ajuntai Samotracianum jegaa , kashinia duwi Neapolisnum jegabiaji .

text: And from thence to Philippi , which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia , and a colony : and we were in that city abiding certain days .
text2: Nui pujusá , Filipos Macedonianmaya yaakat dekas iman , Romanmaya aidau batsamtainum jegawabiaji . Nunika nui machik tsawan pujusabiaji .

text: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side , where prayer was wont to be made ; and we sat down , and spake unto the women which resorted thither .
text2: Nuniamunum tsawan ayamtai tsawagmatai , yaakat ukuaku namaká uwet jegawabiaji , jutii anentaimsaik judío aidau Apajuí aujtaijig awis awatai tau asaja . Nunika jegaa pekaamsaja nuwa aidau ijunjaju chicham ujabiaji .

text: And a certain woman named Lydia , a seller of purple , of the city of Thyatira , which worshipped God , heard us : whose heart the Lord opened , that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul .
text2: Nunú nuwa aidaunum nuwa Lidia daagtin Tiatiranmaya , jaanch yamakaitkau dekas pegkeg aidaun sujin , Apajuinash emematin asa ekeemas antú ekeemayi . Nunittaman Apajuí anentaimtijabi Pablo etsegbaunash shiig antukti tusa .

text: And when she was baptized , and her household , she besought us , saying , If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come into my house , and abide there . And she constrained us .
text2: Dutikamu asa Jisusan nemagkamtai , ashí niina patayijai yamigbaiji . Nu dutikam : — Atumesh , wi dekas Jisusan nemagkau waitkugmek , mina jegajuí kaunajum kanagtajum , — tujamkui ni pujamunum wegabiaji .

text: And it came to pass , as we went to prayer , a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us , which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying :
text2: Nunika pujusá Apajuí aujtainum wegajin , nuwa inak wakan pegkegchau dekamtikam etsejin igkumpaktatus jiintugmakmayi . Nunú nuwa dutika takatai niina apuji aidauk kuashat kuichkin juwidau .

text: The same followed Paul and us , and cried , saying , These men are the servants of the most high God , which shew unto us the way of salvation .
text2: Nunú nuwa , jutii Pablojai wegajin pataetugmak minis senchi untsumak : — ¡ Ju aents aina juka Apajuí nayaimpinmayaya nuna umijin asag , nuwiya chicham uwemtikagtina nuna atumnash ujapakagtatus minitjamainawai ! — wajau .

text: And this did she many days . But Paul , being grieved , turned and said to the spirit , I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . And he came out the same hour .
text2: Nunak kuashat tsawantai imatú wekaetai , Pablo kajejuk , ayampatua wakan pegkegchau nuwauchinum pujaun chichajak : — Jisukristu daajin tajame , aanú nuwauch ukuakum jiinkim wetá , — tiuwai . Nunú tusa tamawaik wakan pegkegchaush wamkes jiinki wegak nuwanak agkan ukukiuwai .

text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone , they caught Paul and Silas , and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers ,
text2: Tujash nuna apuji aidau ni dekamamtai kuichik jutaijin dutikashmin wajasmatai , Pablon Silasjai achiká jukiag , chicham dekatasa ijuntainum apu aidau emtin ejegawaju .

text: And brought them to the magistrates , saying , These men , being Jews , do exceedingly trouble our city ,
text2: Dutika chichaman epegkin aidaunum ejeyag chichainak : — Jujú judío aents ainayatak iina yaaktajin taawag dapamkagtuinawai ,

text: And teach customs , which are not lawful for us to receive , neither to observe , being Romans .
text2: nuninak ditá pujutjin jutii Romanmaya aidautik makichkish dutikmainchauwaitag nuna jintinjamainawai , — tuidau .

text: And the multitude rose up together against them : and the magistrates rent off their clothes , and commanded to beat them .
text2: Nuna tiagtai aents aidauk Pablon Bernabejai pampantug wajatkiagmatai , apu chichaman epegkin aidaushkam : — Awikjum numí suwimatajum , — tusa inamjau .

text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them , they cast them into prison , charging the jailor to keep them safely :
text2: Timatai senchi suwí suwimainakua , achikbau chimpitainum egkeawag , achikbaun kuitamin aidaun : — Wejum shiig kuitamkatajum , — tusa awemajui .

text: Who , having received such a charge , thrust them into the inner prison , and made their feet fast in the stocks .
text2: Nunú tusa tima , achikbau kuitamnushkam juki , jegá awayaa imau nagkatkamunum ejegan , taapna dawe dekapasa agtukbaunum nawen wegajug shiig chanuag kuwakchamin ema ukukiuwai .

text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed , and sang praises unto God : and the prisoners heard them .
text2: Imatika ukukim , Pablo Silasjai aehaet Apajuin aujuinak , kantamtan kantam wajagtai , tikich aents achigbau chimpijushkam antú batsatu .

text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken : and immediately all the doors were opened , and every one ' s bands were loosed .
text2: Imatú batsatai pachiachmau senchi uujak , jega aents achiká chimpitai ajigbau aidaun senchi pegau , imatiktai ashí waitig ujanjauwai . Tuja aents achiká jiju ikagmauwai jigkakbaushkam tsujinag kakekaju .

text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , he drew out his sword , and would have killed himself , supposing that the prisoners had been fled .
text2: Imaniai achikbau kuitamin kanag tepaushkam shintaak diistakamá , ashí waitig ujanag aun wainak , aents achigbau aidauk shiyakeapi tusa , espadajin ukuini juwakug maamata tau .

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , Do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
text2: Nunitai Pablo senchi untsuká : — Maamawaipa , jutiik ashí betek batsatji , — tiuwai .

text: Then he called for a light , and sprang in , and came trembling , and fell down before Paul and Silas ,
text2: Tutai achikbaun kuitamnushkam : — Jii ekemakjum sujustajum , — tau . Tutai jii ejentuntam juwakug , sapí sapigjai tupikaki Pablo Silasjai wajamunum kujaukmaikia wayakug tikishmatjau .

text: And brought them out , and said , Sirs , what must I do to be saved ?
text2: Dutika juki agaa jiikí : — Muun aidauh , ¿ wisha wajukmainaitja uwemjata tusanush ? — tusa iniau .

text: And they said , Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
text2: Tusa iniinam dita aiinak : — Apu Jisukristuig dekaskeapi tita , nu nuniakum amek ashí amina pataim aidaujai uwemjattame .

text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord , and to all that were in his house .
text2: Nuna tusa Jisukristu chichamenashkam niina ujaak ashí niina patayijai ujakuí .

text: And he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , straightway .
text2: Dutikam aehaet aig , achikbaun kuitamnushkam Pablon Silasjai suwimku tsupigbau numpa waigkun nijatkau . Dutikam nuaduí ditashkam ashí nuna patayijai yamikuí .

text: And when he had brought them into his house , he set meat before them , and rejoiced , believing in God with all his house .
text2: Nu dutikawajam ditá jeen jukiag yujumkan ajamsajui . Nu aentsuk ashí ni patayijai shiig aneasaju , Apajuiyai dekaskeapi tusag sujumankaju asag .

text: And when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , Let those men go .
text2: Kashikmas apu chichaman epegkin aidau , achijatin aidaun awetiaju , aents achikbaun kuitamnun ujaktí Pablon Silasjai jiiktinme tusag .

text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul , The magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore depart , and go in peace .
text2: Tibau asa achikbaun kuitamnushkam Pablon chichajak : — Apu chichaman epegkin aidau chichaman akupjutak akupkati tujutne , nunin asamtai jiinkijum shiig aneasjum wetajum , — tiuwai .

text: But Paul said unto them , They have beaten us openly uncondemned , being Romans , and have cast us into prison ; and now do they thrust us out privily ? nay verily ; but let them come themselves and fetch us out .
text2: Tusa tama Pablo achijatin aidaun chichajak : — Jutiik Romanmaya aents ainajinig shiig chichaman dekagtamtsuk tuwakbaunum asutamawag aents achiká chimpitainum egkepawagmae ; dutijabau ainayatkush , ¿ wagka yamaish tikich waipainatsaigkish uuká jigmakta tuinawa ? Duka nunimaitsui , dekas dita taawag iinak jigmaktinme , — tuidau .

text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates : and they feared , when they heard that they were Romans .
text2: Tusa timatai achijatin aidau apu chichaman epegkin aidaun jegajuawag , timae tusag ujaidau . Tama nuna antukag senchi ishamkaju , Romanmaya aentsuitjai tau asagmatai .

text: And they came and besought them , and brought them out , and desired them to depart out of the city .
text2: Nunikag Pablon , Silasjai wejiaju : — Wait aneasjum tsagkugtugtajum — tita tusag . Dutikawag jiikiag : — Juig pujutsuk wetajum , — tusag awemaju .

text: And they went out of the prison , and entered into the house of Lydia and when they had seen the brethren , they comforted them , and departed .
text2: Tiajam jiinkiag Lidia jeen shiyakaju , nui jegawag aents Jisusa nemajuidaun wainkag shiig anentain ichichtujag ukuinak shiyakajui .

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the Jews :
text2: Nunik ashinak yaakat Anfípolis , nuigtú Apoloniajai nagkaikiag jegawajui Tesalonicanum jega judío aidau ijuntaijin .

text: And Paul , as his manner was , went in unto them , and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures ,
text2: Pablok tuke nunin asa , jega ijuntainum wayauwai , nunik kampatum tsawan ayamtainum judío aidaujai Apajuí chichame agagbaun pachis tudayinau .

text: Opening and alleging , that Christ must needs have suffered , and risen again from the dead ; and that this Jesus , whom I preach unto you , is Christ .
text2: Dutikak , Kristuk waitkasa maam ataktú nantaktinai tusa agagbauwa nuna pachis jintias ujaak : — Wi Jisusan pachisan atumin ujaajim , nuuwai Kristuk , — tiuwai .

text: And some of them believed , and consorted with Paul and Silas ; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and of the chief women not a few .
text2: Nuna tutai wajumchik judío aidau Jisusan dekaskeapi tusag sujumankaju , nunik ditashkam Pablo Silasjai wekaebaunum ditajai ijunjajui . Tuja kuashat griego Apajuí emematin aidau , nuigtú kuashat nuwa puyatjusa diitai aidaushkam , Jisusan dekaskeapi tusag nemagkaju .

text: But the Jews which believed not , moved with envy , took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort , and gathered a company , and set all the city on an uproar , and assaulted the house of Jason , and sought to bring them out to the people .
text2: Tujash judío dekaskeapi tuinatsu nu kajeenak , aents pegkegchau , nuigtú daki aidaun ipaa ditajai ijunjag aentsun dapampainak ashí yaaktanmayanak ekaajaju ; nunikag Jasogkan jeen jetekaju , Pablo Silasjai pujatsuash , pujakuig japikí jukiaja aents dekas tuwakbaunum ejegami tusag .

text: And when they found them not , they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city , crying , These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also ;
text2: Tujash Pablonak Silasjai wainkachag , Jasogkan , tikich Jisusa nemajin aidaujai jukiag yaaktanum dekas apu pujamunum ejegawajui . Dutikawag : — Ju aentsua ju , jimag aents ashí nugkanum wekagas dapamkagtú wekaenuwe nunú juwi iinashkam tajutjamamtai ,

text: Whom Jason hath received : and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , one Jesus .
text2: Jasón niina jeen awayaa apusae , ashí ju aina juka Roma apujiya nu chicham umiktin najanamua nunak dakituinawai , ditak tikich apu Jisus daagtin awai tuidau asag .

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
text2: Nunú tabaun aents aidauk , ashí apu aidaujai antukag , senchi pampaidau .

text: And when they had taken security of Jason , and of the other , they let them go .
text2: Imatiagtai Jasón tikich Jisusa nemajin aidaujai apu aidaun chichajuinak : — Jasta , dekas jutii yajá wetajum tusa awemanti , nu tau asá kuichik ukuaji , iina yaaktajin jiinjagmataig ataktú awagtugkitajum , untsu jiinjashmataig kuichkik tuke jukitajum , — tiaju . Nuna tiagmatai apu aidau Jasogkan , tikich Jisusa nemajin aidaunash akupkajui .

text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea : who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews .
text2: Dutikawajam wamkesag kashi aig , Pablonak Silasjai Bereanum awemajui . Dutikam jegawag judío aidau ijuntaijin wegajui .

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of mind , and searched the scriptures daily , whether those things were so .
text2: Bereanmaya aidauk Tesalonicanmaya aidaun nagkagas shiig anentaimkau asag , wakegas chicham etsegbaunash antujuidau , nuninak kashí kashinig Apajuí chichamen shiig kuitamas aujuidau , nu tawa dusha dekas ajampashit tusag dekawagtatus .

text: Therefore many of them believed ; also of honourable women which were Greeks , and of men , not a few .
text2: Imanidau asag kuashat judío aidauk dekaskeapi tuidauk Jisusan nemagkajui , tuja griego aidau , nuigtú nuwa eme anentsá diitai aidaushkam dekaskeapi tusag Jisusan nemagkajui .

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea , they came thither also , and stirred up the people .
text2: Nuniagtatman judío Tesalonicanmaya aidau , Pablo Berea wekagas Apajuí chichamen etsejui tabaun dekaawag , shimutkag nuwishkam aentsun dapampakaju .

text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea : but Silas and Timotheus abode there still .
text2: Nudiagtai Jisusa nemajin aidau Pablon : Amek nayants anunjukam wekaesam wetá tusag awemaju , nuniai Silas Timoteojai juwakajui .

text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens : and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed , they departed .
text2: Pablo uyunaidauk Atenas ejegawag ukukiaju . Nunú waketiagtai Pablo , Silasan , Timoteojai chichaman akupjak : “ Waamak juwi taatnume , juwi ditajai igkuniktajai ” , tiuwai .

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred in him , when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry .
text2: Pablo Atenas jegaa , Silasan Timoteojai dakak pujus , shiig kuashat anentain idajtus diyau , ashí yaakta nuanuig imá ditá apajimtai aina duke ayau asamtai .

text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews , and with the devout persons , and in the market daily with them that met with him .
text2: Nuniau asamtai jega judío aidau ijuntaiya nui wayaa judío aidaujai kuashat tudayu , tikich Apajuin umijuidaujaishkam , nuniak kashí kashinig yaakta ejapeen aents tuwakbaunmash dutiksag tudayu .

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans , and of the Stoicks , encountered him . And some said , What will this babbler say ? other some , He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods : because he preached unto them Jesus , and the resurrection .
text2: Nunisag , aents Epicuro daagtin jintinkagtuamun aujin aidau Epicúreos tutai , tikich aents Zenón daagtin jintiamun aujin aidau Estoicos tutai aidaujai kautkag , Pablojai tudayinau . Nuniagtai tikich aidau : — ¿ Au aentsush wajina pachisaya imá chichawa ? — tuidau . Tiagtai tikich chichaidau : — Auk tikich nugkanmaya apajuijimtain pachis etsejin aina numamtinai , — tuidau . Nunak Pablo Jisusan pachis yamajam chichaman etsejak ni mantamna nantakbaujai etseju asamtai , tiajui .

text: And they took him , and brought him unto Areopagus , saying , May we know what this new doctrine , whereof thou speakest , is ?
text2: Tusag Pablon , Areópago tutainum , apu aidau ijuntaijin ejegawag iniinak : — ¿ Jutiish ame yamajam jintinkagtam nunú tukagtumainchaukaitam ?

text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears : we would know therefore what these things mean .
text2: Ame jintinkagtam duka jutii antushtai jintinkagtame , nuniau asamin jutiish nunash wajina takug tawa tusa dekatasa wakegainaji , — tuidau .

text: ( For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell , or to hear some new thing . )
text2: Ashí Atenas batsamin aidauk , nuigtú tikich ikaya kaunkau nui batsamin aidaushkam , yamajam chicham etsegbaun antuinakjag tikichnak uyumatsuk , nuna shiig dekawagtatus wakeyin asag tuidau .

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars ' hill , and said , Ye men of Athens , I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious .
text2: Nuna tiagtai , Pablo Areopagonum jegau asa , nuwi ejapeen wajantá chichaak : “ Atenasnumia aidauh , atum apajimjum duka dekas pujawapi tusajum anentaimtin ainajum nunak wainjime .

text: For as I passed by , and beheld your devotions , I found an altar with this inscription , TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship , him declare I unto you .
text2: Atumi apajuijum emematku ijuntaigmin diyakun wekaesan , altarnum ‘ ¡ Apajuí wainchatai ! ’ tusa agaja adujkamun wainkamjai . Nunú ‘ Apajuí wainchatai ’ atumesh waintsuk emematin ainajum nuna wishakam pachisan etsegjai .

text: God that made the world and all things therein , seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
text2: “ Apajuí nugkan najana , ashí nugkanum ayaa nunash najanauwa duke , nayaimpin nugkanashkam apujig . Nigka aents jega Apajuí ememattai atí tusa jegamkamunmag pujuchui .

text: Neither is worshipped with men ' s hands , as though he needed any thing , seeing he giveth to all life , and breath , and all things ;
text2: Tuja aents takagtusmatai pujustajai tusag atsumchauwai . Niiyai pujutnash , mayainash ashí wají aina nuna sukagtinuk .

text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth , and hath determined the times before appointed , and the bounds of their habitation ;
text2: “ Tuja makichik aents najanamua nuanuiyag yujak ashí nugkanum batsamsatnume tiuwai . Dutika mamiktujui tsawantan tuja nugka dita batsamsatnunashkam ,

text: That they should seek the Lord , if haply they might feel after him , and find him , though he be not far from every one of us :
text2: nui batsamas mina egatkatnume nuninak dekajuatnume tusa . Tujash dekaskenmag jutiijaig atushtak atsui .

text: For in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain also of your own poets have said , For we are also his offspring .
text2: Apajuí senchijin pujuidau asá buchituinaji ; nunisag atumin muunjum dita anentaibaujinian agau aidaushkam : ‘ Jutiik Apajuin uchijí ainaji ’ , tiajui .

text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold , or silver , or stone , graven by art and man ' s device .
text2: Apajuin uchijí ainakuik , makichik aents nigki anentaimas , ni anentaimtamun dakumak oroikish , jiju platayaikish , nuna dutikachkush ayatak kayaikesh najanamu aina nunintsukaitai Apajuik tusaik anentaimtumaitsuji .

text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at ; but now commandeth all men every where to repent :
text2: Nunak aents dekachu asa nuniagtaish , Apajuí pachitsuk idaisau akushkam , yamaik aents ashí nugkanum batsamin aidaush , dita tudau takaamujinak idayinak , minak nemagtuktinme , tawai .

text: Because he hath appointed a day , in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained ; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men , in that he hath raised him from the dead .
text2: Apajuik makichik tsawantan mamikiauwai , nunú tsawan jegatai ashí nugkanmaya aidaun , Kristu Aentsmaga Akiinau mantamna ataktú nantakiuwa nuna , yamaik aents pegkegchau aidau , pegkeg aidaujai etegjam akankam ijumjata titin asa ” , tiuwai .

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked : and others said , We will hear thee again of this matter .
text2: Mantamdauwaitak aneantu tabaun antukag tikich aidauk ayatak dushikinai , tikich chichainak : — Dekas imá pegkeg ju tame duka tikich tsawantin antakuish antukagmi , duwi etsegkata , — tiaju .

text: So Paul departed from among them .
text2: Tiagmatai Pabloshkam ukukiuwai .

text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him , and believed : among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
text2: Tujash wajumak aents Apajuin dekaskeapi tusag nemagkajui . Nuanuí pachitkau Dionisio daagtin , Areopagonum ijunin , tuja makichik nuwa Dámaris daagtinchakam , nuigtú tikich aidaushkam .

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
text2: Pablo nuna dutika ukuak , Atenas jiinki yaakat Corintonum weuwai .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Nuanuí jegakmá makichik judío Pontonmaya Áquila daagtin niina nuwe Priscilajai Italianmaya tau asamtai , Pablo ijagsatatus weuwai . Nunak apu Claudio ashí judío aidau Roma batsata duka jinjatnume tau asamtai nunikui .

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: Nunik jegakmá duwapen apijug jegamin asag , duwapen apijainak batsamtatman wainak , niina takataijijai ditashkam betek takaidau asamtai , Pabloshkam nui juwakui , ditajai ijunag takastatus .

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: Tuja ashí tsawan ayamtai tsawautaik , jega ijuntainum jegaa , judío aidaun , griego aidaunashkam , Kristun dekaskeapi tumamtikiagtatus tuke ujasagké au .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Silas Timoteojai Macedonia pujau taawagmatai , Pablok imá chicham etsegbauwa nunak takau , dutikak judío aidaunak : “ Apajuí etegkamu Kristu , atum dakajum nunuke Jisusak ” tusa chichagkagtau .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: Tujash judío aidauk Pablonak shiwagmaidau , nuninak pegkegchaun chichajuidau . Imatjuinamu asa Pabloshkam niina nugkutaijin pegajá wajantá chichaak : — Atumek bakumajum megkaekatin ainagme , wika nunak uyumamaitsujai . Yamaya juwi nagkamsanuk wika tikich aents judiuchu aidaunum wetatjai , — tiuwai .

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Nuna tusa ukuak jega ijuntainmaya jiinki , Justo Apajuí umijin nui ayaumas pujaunum jegau .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: Tuja Crispo , jega ijuntaiya nuna apuji ashí niina patayijai Jisusan dekaskeapi tusag nemagkaju . Tikich Corintonmayashkam kuashat aents nunú chichaman antukag dekaskeapi tusag yamimakaju .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: Nuniku ai Apu Jisus Pablon kashi paan wantintuk chichajak : “ Sapigmakaipa , chichagkagtam duka idaitsuk chichagkagtukta .

text: For I am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee : for I have much people in this city .
text2: Wi amijaig wekaejai , makichkish amina pegkegchau awajtamkatasag achigmamaitsui . Ju yaakta juwishkam mina aentsug aidauk kuashat ajutui ” , tiuwai .

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: Nunú tima Pablok Corintonmak makichik mijan jimaituk , nuwiya aents aidaunash Apajuí chichamen jintintak pujusuí .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Nunú tsawantinig Galión Acayanmaya apuji we pujai judío aidau ijunjag , Pablon shimutuk achiká jukiag , apu pujamunum ejegawag ,

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: apun chichajuinak : — Ju aentsua ju ashí aents aidaun ni wagagki dekas Apajuiya duke emematmain ainagme tayatak , Moisés chicham umiktajum tibauwa nunak umiatsui , — tuidau .

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: Tiagtai Pabloshkam chichaktatus nagkamata taig , Apu Galión judío aidaun chichajak : — Ju aents pegkegchau takasbau , nuniachkush magkagtuamukesh pachisjum takugminig atum judío aidautijum tajum nunak antugmainaitjime ;

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: tujash ayatak chichama nunak , aentsun daaji aidaun pachitus , atumin chicham umitaijum aidaujai chichawai . Nuniau asamtai imá atumek juka iwajatajum , wika aanin aidau epegkeata tusanuk wakegatsjai .

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Tusa chicham epegkeaku ijuntainmayan agaa jiijú .

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Dutikawajam ashí aents aidauk jiinjag Sóstenes , dekas jega ijuntain apujiya nuna achikag , apush wajasá dii wajataig suwimaidau . Dutikiagtaishkam apu Galiogkak shiig pachikchau .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: Pablo Corinto Jisusa nemajuidaujai kuashat tsawan ijunag pujus , Áquila Priscila aatus Siria nugkanum ashinkauwai . Tujash Cencrea wetatus botenum egkemtsuk , Pablo awamajui , ni duwik nuniktajai tibaujin umikta tau asa .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: Nunik yaakat Efeso anumkamunum , Pablo Aquilan Priscilajai ukuak nigka jega ijuntainum weu , nunik judío ijunjamunum Jisusan pachis chichasú .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Nunikmatai Pablon : — Wait aneasam juwi dukap tsawan pujusam wetá , tusa segaidau , tujash nigka dakitjauwai ,

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: nuniak : — Jerusalén jista atata nui pujuta tusan wegajai , Apajuish wakegakuig ataktú waketjukin tajuattajime atumin wainkatasan , — tiuwai . Nuna tusa botenum egkemag Efeson ukuak weuwai .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Cesarea jegaa Jerusalén weu , nuwiya Jisusa nemajuidaun kumpamatatus ; nunik Antioquía weuwai .

text: And after he had spent some time there , he departed , and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , strengthening all the disciples .
text2: Nui jegaa dukap tsawan pujus ataktú jiinkiu , Galacia , nugkanum , Frigia nugkanmash ashí Jisusa nemajuidaun makí makichik anentain ichichtugtatus .

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Nunika wekaebaunum makichik judío Apolos daagtin , yaakat Alejandrianmaya Efesonum jegauwai . Nunú aentsuk Apajuí chichame agagbaunashkam shiig dekau asa , imatiksag shiig chichagkagtin aajakuí .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Nigka , Apu Jisus pachisaish jintintuamu asa , wakekegat shiig paan antumainun Jisusan pachisashkam jintinkagtau , tujash nigka imá Juan Yamijatak jintinkagtuamunak dekau .

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: Apolos jega ijuntainum wajantá shiig machikish puyatkas wajas chichamujin Priscila Aquilajai antujuk , ajum chichamujin ashimkamtai akanak jukiag , Jisusan pachis shiig juní awai tusag ujakajui .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: Apolos Acaya nugkanum wetai , Efesonmaya Jisusa nemajin aidau papiin agatjaju , nuwiya Jisusa nemajuidaush shiig anentus jukitnume tusag . Dutikam Apolos Acaya jegaa , Apajuí yayasam Jisusan dekaskeapi tiaju aidaun kuashat yaigkuí .

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Aatus nuniau asamtai judío aidaushkam , Jisusak Apajuí awemachbauwai tumainchau dekapedau . Wagki duwik Apajuin etsegtin aidau Jisus pachisa agagbaun iwaintug : “ Ju Jisus taji duke Kristuk ” , tau asamtai .

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: Apolos Corinto pujai , Pablok mujanmanini tsupina Efesonum jegakmá , kuashat aents Jisusa nemajuidaun wainkauwai .

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: Nunik : — ¿ Atumesh Jisus nemagkugmesh Wakaní Pegkejish jukiuk ainajum ? — tusa iniau . Tama dita aiinak : — Jutiik Wakaní Pegkeji awai tabauk machikish antuchuitji , — tiaju .

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: Tiagtai awentsag iniak : — ¿ Atumnash ya yamigmajuitjume ? Tusa tama dita aimainak : — Jutiinak Juan yamigmajui , — tuidau .

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: Tiagtai Pablo ayaak : — Juagkak ayatak aents aidau tudau takatan idayagtai yamiijakuí , nuniakush mina ukujui minitta nunú dekaskeapi titajum , — tiuwai Jisusan pachis .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Nunú tabaun antukag Apu Jisusa daajin yamimakajui .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: Nunikagmatai Pablo ditá buuken achikmatai , Wakaní Pegkejishkam ditanash egkemtujajui . Dutikawajam ditashkam tikich chichaman chichaidau , nuninak Apajuí tabaunash etsejuidau .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: Nuna nunidauk ashí ijumjamak doce aents aajakú ainawai .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: Pablok kampatum nantua imajin jega ijuntainmag wesag pujau , nui jegaa chichagkagtakush ishamkagtutsuk chichau , nuniak aents aidaunash Apajuí inabaujin pachis shiig dekamtikau .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: Tujash wajumak aents aidau antumtikmainchau aidauk dekaskeapi tuinachu . Nunidau asag tikich aents aidaush antuinamunum , yamajam chicham etsegbaun pegkegchau chichajuidau . Nudiagtai Pablok Jisusa nemajuidaunak ashí yajuak , makichik aents Tirano daagtinun jintinkagtutaijin jeganum utsaa , ditanak kashí kashinig Apajuin chichamenak jintintu .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: Dutika takaak jimag mijan pujusuí . Nuniau asamtai ashí aents Asia nugkanum batsamin aidauk , judío aidaujai , tikich judiuchu aidaushkam Jisusa chichame etsegbaunak antukajui .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: Apajuishkam Pablon yayau dutikam kuashat aents dutikmainchau aidaun iwaidau .

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: Imatikau asamtai pañuelo aidaun jukiag , jaanchikish Pablo iyashin antigkag aents jaun ejeti , nunash antigkag etsagaidau , dutikam wakan pegkegchau aidaushkam jiinaidau .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Dutikiagtai wajumak judío aidau jintá yujasag , wakan pegkegchau aentsun egkemtuaun jiijuidau asag , Apu Jisusa daajin adaisag jiikta tuidau ; nuninak wakan pegkegchaun chichajuinak : “ Pablo Jisusan etsegta nuna daajin jiinkitajum ” , tuidau .

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: Nunak sacerdote aidaun apuji Esceva daagtin judío aentsua nuna uchijí siete aajakajua nu dutikaidau .

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: Nuna tiagtai , wakan pegkegchau ayaak : “ Wika Jisusnak wainnujai , tuja Pablosh yaita nunak shiig dekajai ; tujash atumesh ¿ ya ainagme ? ”

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Nuna tusa tamawaik , aents wakan pegkegchau egkemtuamua dushakam tupikatki achikag , ashí ditanak wagagkiag senchi suwimaidau , imatikainam jegan ukuinak shiig wisú , tikich upu upujukim wegauke asajui .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Nu nunikbaun judío aidau , judiuchu aidaushkam Efesonum batsamin aidauk ashí antukag , senchi ishamkajui . Imaninak Apu Jisusan pachisag emematuidau .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: Nunisag kuashat Jisusan dekaskeapi tusag nemagkaju aidauk , kaunawag ashí antuinamunum dita pegkegchau takataiji aidaunak ashí etsegtumaidau .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: Nuigtushkam kuashat aents iwanchin papijin aujus takajakú aidaushkam , papijin ikaunmak , ashí aents wainainamunum apekaju . Nunú papí aina nuna akikeg cincuenta mil kuichik tumain aajakuí .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Aatus Apu Jisusa chichameg niina senchijijai , ashí tikich nugkanmash pampag wegau .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: Nunú nunik nagkaemakiu ai , Pablo : — Macedonianmaya aidaun , Acayanmaya aidaujai ijagsatjai , nunikan Jerusalén jegatjai , — tiuwai . Nuigtushkam : — Jerusalén jeganuk Roma wemainaitjai , — tiuwai .

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Nuna tusa jimag niina yain aidau Timoteon , Erastojai Macedonianum awemajui , nunik nigka machik tsawan Asia pujustatus juwakui .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Nunú tsawantai Yamajam chicham pachisa kuashat pampandayamu asauwai .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: Nunak Demetrio daagtin , jiju plata tutain takau asa , jega Diana ememattain dakumas najanu , dutika sujuk niijai takau aidaujai kuashat kuichkin juidau .

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: Nuniak aents niijai takau aidaujai , nuigtú tikich ditajai betekmamtuk takau aidaunash ipaa ijunjag chichainak : “ Muun aidauh , atumek dekagme , iik jujú jutika sujaku shiig pujú ainaji .

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Tujash atumesh wainjume , antutash antugjume , jujú Pablok apajuí aidau aents najanamu aina duka apajuichu ainawai tusa , kuashat aents aidaun , dekaskeap nuninaita tumamtikui , nunak imá Efesowa juwig tatsui , ashí Asia nugkanmayanashkam tu wekaetawai .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Juna jutika juka shiig puyatjumainai , jutii sujuinag juna sujumainchau etamkamtaig megkaemainaitji , tujash imá duke nunimaitsui , jega iina apajuiji Diana daagtina nuna jeeshkam pachikchamu atatui , nunitai Asia nugka juwiya , ashí tikich nugkanmaya aidaush emematin agma nunak dakitug idaisagtatui . ”

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Tiagtai antukag , senchi kajekag untsumainak : “ ¡ Diana Efesonmayanua juke dekas imanuk ! ” wajaidau .

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Imataidau asag ashí yaaktanmayag shiig dekashmin wajasag wainak pachimdaekaju . Nunikag jimag aents Macedonianmaya Pablon uyunaidaun , Gayo daagtin , Aristarcojai pujuttaman achikag jukiag , japí japinakua dekas jega shiig muun aents aidau tuwatain ejegawaju .

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
text2: Nuna dutikawagmatai Pablo nui wayaa aents aidaun ausatatus weta tutaishkam , Jisusa nemajin aidau : Weepa , tusag emetuawajui .

text: And certain of the chief of Asia , which were his friends , sent unto him , desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre .
text2: Asianmaya apu aidau , wajumak Pablo kumpají aidaushkam nigka auna aanina awig pachinkaigka , tusag chichaman akupjukajui .

text: Some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was confused ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
text2: Nuniai ijunjamunum wajumak aents makichik wajiin pachisag senchi untsumaidau , nuniai tikich aidauk tikichin pachisag untsumaidau , aents aidauk kuashat pachimdagaidau , nuniai kuashat tikich aidauk dekainachu , wajina pachisag ijunjaje nunak .

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander beckoned with the hand , and would have made his defence unto the people .
text2: Imadiagtai judío aidau Alejandron shitakiag emaidau , ame tikich aidaush shiig ujaktá tusag , dutikam Alejandroshkam uwejen takuinu bitat asatnume tusa , judío aidaun ayamjus ashí aents antuinamunum chichaktatus .

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Nu chichatai diikmag judío aentsun wainkag , senchi untsumkag : “ ¡ Diana Efesonmayanua juke dekas imanuk ! ” wajai wajainakua jimag hora amainun ejesattak wegagtai ,

text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people , he said , Ye men of Ephesus , what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana , and of the image which fell down from Jupiter ?
text2: nunú yaaktanmaya apu chichatai agatin wajantá , imatuidaun itatmitkak chichaak : “ Efesonmaya muun aidauh , ashí tikich nugkanmaya aidaush dekainawai , jujú yaakta juwiya aidau , apajuí Diana ememattaiya nuna jeenak kuitamkati tibauwai , ashí niina niimejai betekak nayaimpinmaya iyaajua nunashkam .

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rashly .
text2: Imaan dekaidau asag , junak wainkayai tumain ainatsui . Dekas bitat asatajum , wainkajum shiig anentaimtsuk pegkegchauk dutikawaigpajum .

text: For ye have brought hither these men , which are neither robbers of churches , nor yet blasphemers of your goddess .
text2: Jujú aents atum juwi itaujum juka , atumi apajuijum ememattai jega nunakesh pegkegchauk ematsui , apajuigminakesh pegkegchauk chichagtsui .

text: Wherefore if Demetrius , and the craftsmen which are with him , have a matter against any man , the law is open , and there are deputies : let them implead one another .
text2: Demetrio , niijai takau aina nujai , tikich aentsjai chichaman tudaitatus wakegainakug , apu chichaman epegkin aidau batsata nui ditak wegag , makí makichik ditanua nunak tudaimain ainawai .

text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters , it shall be determined in a lawful assembly .
text2: Untsu atum tikich tumain ajutjamainakuig , nunú pachisjumek dekas ijunjamunum tumain ainajume .

text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day ' s uproar , there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse .
text2: Yamai pampandaibau asa juka puyatjumainnum pujaji , apu Romanmaya dekaa wají pampanjume tujamkuish tumainnum batsattsuji . ”

text: And when he had thus spoken , he dismissed the assembly .
text2: Nuna tusa aents aidaunak ishiakui .

text: And after the uproar was ceased , Paul called unto him the disciples , and embraced them , and departed for to go into Macedonia .
text2: Nunú pampandayamu nagkankamtai , Pablo Jisusa nemajin aidaun untsukú . Dutika chichá chichagkawa ashimak , ditan pagkuk akateg ukuinak , Macedonia weuwai .

text: And when he had gone over those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into Greece ,
text2: Nui wekagas ashí Jisusa nemajuidaunash ijajus anentain ichichtug ukuak Grecia jegauwai .

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: Nui kampatum nantu pujus : “ Siria nugkanmag lanchanum wetajai ” , tusa pujukmá dekauwai , judío aidau Pablo maami tusag uminas dakainamun : — Nunik dekas kukag Macedoniaya atú nagkaemaktajai , — tiuwai .

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea ; and of the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timotheus ; and of Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
text2: Tusa wetai saetukajui Bereanmaya aents Sópater daagtin Pirro uchijiya nu , Aristarco Segundojai Tesalonicanmaya aidau , Gayo Derbenmaya dushakam tikich Timoteo , nuigtú Tíquico , Trofimojai Asianmaya aina dushakam .

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas .
text2: Ju yatsut aina juka ditá eemag yaakat Troasnum jegawag dakagmagmayi .

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to Troas in five days ; where we abode seven days .
text2: Ditak nuninai jutiik ukunum juwakaja pag levaduragtuchu inajuamu yuwaku jistamtai tsawagmatai , nunú inagkeaki Filiposnumiati botenum jiinki , cinco tsawan Troasnum jegaa , nui makichik tumig inagkeakiabiaji .

text: And upon the first day of the week , when the disciples came together to break bread , Paul preached unto them , ready to depart on the morrow ; and continued his speech until midnight .
text2: Tumig tsawagmatai ijunjabiaji Jisus jakamu anentaimtusa pag yuwawagtasa , nuniamunum Pablo kashinia duwi jiinkitin asa , Jisusa nemajin aidaun jintí jintintai aehaet wajasuí .

text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber , where they were gathered together .
text2: Jutiik jega yakí tesamunum kuashat lámpara ekemagbaunum ijunja batsamiaji .

text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus , being fallen into a deep sleep : and as Paul was long preaching , he sunk down with sleep , and fell down from the third loft , and was taken up dead .
text2: Nuniamunum makichik datsauch Eutico daagtin , ventananum eketu . Pablo chichá chichagkagtakua ayatak emau asamtai kaja achikuí , dutikam shiig initjau kanag yakí kampatum jega ekenbaunmaya juwaki nugká iyawabi . Nunikmatai inankamag jakaun inankiajui .

text: And Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , Trouble not yourselves ; for his life is in him .
text2: Nunikmatai Pablo akaetuki , uchin pagkuk inankiabi . Dutika Jisusa nemajuidaun chichajak : — Puyatkaigpajum iwaakui , — tiabi .

text: When he therefore was come up again , and had broken bread , and eaten , and talked a long while , even till break of day , so he departed .
text2: Nuna tusa Pablo ataktú yakí waka , Jisus mantamnamujin anentaimtusag pagkan puug yuwa chichá chichagkagtakua , tuke tsawampag weuwai .

text: And they brought the young man alive , and were not a little comforted .
text2: Nunitai uchin iwaakun jukiag shiig aneasag juwakajui .

text: And we went before to ship , and sailed unto Assos , there intending to take in Paul : for so had he appointed , minding himself to go afoot .
text2: Jutiik iiyá emka lanchanum juwaki Aso wegabiaji , nuanuí Pablo igkugka jukitasa , nigka : “ Kukag wetasan wakegajai ” , tiu asamtai .

text: And when he met with us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
text2: Nunika Pablo Aso taamtai igkunika nui niish egkemjamtai Mitilene jegabiaji .

text: And we sailed thence , and came the next day over against Chios ; and the next day we arrived at Samos , and tarried at Trogyllium ; and the next day we came to Miletus .
text2: Nunika wega wegakua kashinia duwi ajuntai Quío tutainum diiká nanamsabiaji , nui juwaki kashinia duwi Samos anumtainum anumkabiaji . Nunika Trogilio kanaja kashinia duwi Mileto jegawabiaji .

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus , because he would not spend the time in Asia : for he hasted , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost .
text2: Nunak Pablok Asia nugkanum dukap tsawan pujutan dakitau asa , Efesonum wetanak dakitjauwai , waamak Jerusalén jegá niishkam jista Pentecostés pachinkata tau asa .

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called the elders of the church .
text2: Pablo Mileto pujus , Efesonmaya Jisusa nemajuidaun diin aidaun untsukabi kautjuktinme tusa .

text: And when they were come to him , he said unto them , Ye know , from the first day that I came into Asia , after what manner I have been with you at all seasons ,
text2: Tima kaunkamtai chichajak : “ Atumek dekagme wi yama nagkamchakun , juwi Asia nugkanum taawabiag duwi nagkamsan wajuk pujusja duka .

text: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind , and with many tears , and temptations , which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews :
text2: Ashí tsawantai atumjai ijunja pujusan , Apu Jisusan umigkunchakam emematsuk pujusan , kuashat negayai Apajuí augbaijai , tuja mina pataag judío aidaushkam imanik pegkegchau aidaun egatjuinak waitkajianume .

text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you , but have shewed you , and have taught you publickly , and from house to house ,
text2: Nuna imatijuinakuish , wika chicham pegkeg atumin yaimpamaina nunak tuke ujabiajime . Jintinbaijime iwainajan aents tuwakbaunmashkam , tuja atumin jeeminchakam dutiksanuk jintinbaijime .

text: Testifying both to the Jews , and also to the Greeks , repentance toward God , and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Mina pataag Judío aidaunash , judiuchu aidaunashkam tudau takatak idaikujum , Apajuí nemagkujum , Apu Jisuschakam dekaskeapi titajum tusan , ujayajime .

text: And now , behold , I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
text2: Yamaik Jerusalén wegajai , Wakaní Pegkeji awetau asamtai , awish utugtukagtig nunash dekatsuk wegajai .

text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
text2: Untsu Wakaní Pegkejiya nunú , ashí wi yaaktanum wegamunmag chichagtak : ‘ Aminak achigmakag egkepatatus dakagmainawai , waittash imanik kuashat waittsattame ’ , tusa ujatbaunak dekaujai .

text: But none of these things move me , neither count I my life dear unto myself , so that I might finish my course with joy , and the ministry , which I have received of the Lord Jesus , to testify the gospel of the grace of God .
text2: Tujash wika nunak puyatjuchujai , wika mina pujutjunak uyumasnukesh diichujai , wi wakegag nunak Apu Jisus yamajam chicham Apajuí anempa nunú etsegkata tujutbauwa nuna betek umikan , nagkankatasan wakegajai .

text: And now , behold , I know that ye all , among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God , shall see my face no more .
text2: “ Yamaik dekas atumnash tajime , wi atum aidautigmin Apajuí nuní inapaji tusan ujakjim anuiyatigmekesh minak waitkashtin ainagme .

text: Wherefore I take you to record this day , that I am pure from the blood of all men .
text2: Nuaduí yamaya juwik titasan wakejajime , minak atumiin bakumamainuk makichkish atsugtawai .

text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God .
text2: Wagki wika Apajuí tawa nunak makichkish uugká idaitsuk , ashí iwaintusan ujakjim nuaduí .

text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves , and to all the flock , over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers , to feed the church of God , which he hath purchased with his own blood .
text2: Nuaduí atumek kuitamamkatajum , ashí aents Jisusa nemajin aidaun , Apu Jisus niina numpeen akikmak sumakua nuna , Wakaní Pegkejiya nu atumin , uwijá kuitamin aidau uwigjin kuitamajama imatikas , shiig kuitamkatnume tusa aputamsajua duwi .

text: For I know this , that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
text2: Dekajai wi wemataig , tikich aents aidau kuntin kajen uwijan amuwama numamtuk , Jisusa nemajin aidautigmin emegkapakagtatus kautjamkagtatui .

text: Also of your own selves shall men arise , speaking perverse things , to draw away disciples after them .
text2: Atum ainajum anuiyag , dekaskea nunak jintinkagtutsuk , waita nuna jintinkagtaush agtatui , Jisusa nemajuidaush wi jintiag junak umiktinme tusag .

text: Therefore watch , and remember , that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears .
text2: Nu nunikaijum aneaku atajum ; adeagtajum wi kampatum mijadai tuke kashi tsawaishkam , makí makichik atum aidautigmin nuní pujustajum tusan chichagkun , negá negajai imatjimiajim nunú .

text: And now , brethren , I commend you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified .
text2: “ Yatsug aidauh yamaik Apajuiyai idaijime , ni anejatbaunum chichaman sujamsauwa nujai juwaktajum , nu chichamak senchigtinai , iman asa atum Jisusai aan nagkaemasjum kajintsá anentaimtanum yaimpaktatjume , nunitai Apajuí ni aentsji aidaun jukitnun anagkuauwa nunash imatiksag amastatjume .

text: I have coveted no man ' s silver , or gold , or apparel .
text2: Wika tikichdau kuichik , jaanch , oro aidaunakesh wakeejuk wekaechabiajai .

text: Yea , ye yourselves know , that these hands have ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
text2: Nunak nunitsuk wika mina uwejuig takasbaijai , wi atsumamun juwakun tikich wijai yujaidau atsumainamunash yaigtasan .

text: I have shewed you all things , how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , It is more blessed to give than to receive .
text2: Tuke jintinbaijime aajam takamain ainagme , nuniakjum tikich atsumaidaush yaimainaitjume tusan . Adeagtajum Apu Jisus chichaak : ‘ Ni juwak shiig anea nuní nagkaemas shiig aneawai tikichin suwa duka ’ , tiuwa dushakam . ”

text: And when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down , and prayed with them all .
text2: Juna tusa idayak , Pablo ashí tikich aidaujai tikishmajag ditajai ijunas Apajuin aujsajui .

text: And they all wept sore , and fell on Paul ' s neck , and kissed him ,
text2: Nuna nunikag ashí buutuinak , Pablon pagkukag kugkuyanume akatdayinamunum .

text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake , that they should see his face no more . And they accompanied him unto the ship .
text2: Senchi wake besemag dekapianume , Pablo chichaak : Ataktú awenagmek waitkashtinaitjume , tau asamtai . Nunikag botenum egkematatus wetaishkam saetusag ejegawajabi .

text: And it came to pass , that after we were gotten from them , and had launched , we came with a straight course unto Coos , and the day following unto Rhodes , and from thence unto Patara :
text2: Jisusa nemajin aidau ukuinaku lanchanum chimpimjá , tutupit Cos wegabiaji , nunika kashinia duwi Rodas jegaa , nagkaemasaik Pátara jegawabiaji .

text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia , we went aboard , and set forth .
text2: Nui jegakmá lancha Fenicia wegau wainká , nui egkemjá weyaji .

text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus , we left it on the left hand , and sailed into Syria , and landed at Tyre : for there the ship was to unlade her burden .
text2: Nu nagkaiki wesá ajuntai Chipre wainkabiaji ; duka menanmanini ukuaku Siria wegabiaji . Nuniamunum lanchanmayan wajiin jiigta tuinakui Tiro anumkabiaji .

text: And finding disciples , we tarried there seven days : who said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Nui jegakmá Jisusa nemajin aidau wainkaja , nui makichik tumig ditajai batsabiaji . Nuniamunum Wakaní Pegkeji dekamtikamu asag , Pablon chichajuinak : “ Jerusalegkak wemaitsume ” , tiajabi .

text: And when we had accomplished those days , we departed and went our way ; and they all brought us on our way , with wives and children , till we were out of the city : and we kneeled down on the shore , and prayed .
text2: Tujash tibau aig , makichik tumig nagkaemakmatai jiinjabiaji . Nunika wegajin ashí Jisusa nemajin aidauk , ditá nuwe uchijí aidaujai uyuntamas miniyanume yaaktan ukukiag , nunikagmatai nui kaamatkanum utsanawaja ashí tikishmakaja Apajuí ausabiaji .

text: And when we had taken our leave one of another , we took ship ; and they returned home again .
text2: Nunú nunika pagku pagkuní ukunikiaja lanchanum egkemjin ditashkam jeen waketjajabi .

text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre , we came to Ptolemais , and saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
text2: Tironmayati juwakiaja nayants wegamuk , Tolemaidanum jegaa , nui jiinkí Jisusa nemajuidau batsatbaunum jegawaja , chichai chichainakua makichkia kanaja ukukiabiaji .

text: And the next day we that were of Paul ' s company departed , and came unto Caesarea : and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , which was one of the seven ; and abode with him .
text2: Kashinia duwi jiinkiaja Cesarea jegawabiaji . Nunika Jisus chicham etsegtugkatajum tusa etegjamu aina nuna yain siete aajakajua nuwiya , Felipe wekagas chichagkagtina nuna jeen jegaa kanajabiaji .

text: And the same man had four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy .
text2: Felipe nawanji cuatro agkanjam Apajuí etsegtin batsabianume .

text: And as we tarried there many days , there came down from Judaea a certain prophet , named Agabus .
text2: Nuanuig kuashat tsawan pujajin Apajuí etsegtin Judeanmaya Agabo daagtin taawabi ,

text: And when he was come unto us , he took Paul ' s girdle , and bound his own hands and feet , and said , Thus saith the Holy Ghost , So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle , and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
text2: nunik Pablo akachumtaijin juki , uwejen nawenishkam jigkamag chichaak : — Wakaní Pegkeji chichaak , Jerusalén jegamtai judío aidau juna akachumna nuna achikag jigkajag , judiuchu aents aidaunum sujukagtatui tawai , — tiabi .

text: And when we heard these things , both we , and they of that place , besought him not to go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Nuna takui antukaja jutii , Cesareanmaya aidaujai ijuntuja , Pablo chichagku : — Dekas Jerusalegkak weepa , — tibaiji .

text: Then Paul answered , What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart ? for I am ready not to be bound only , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Nunú tajinchakam Pablo ni aigmak : — ¿ Wagka buutkugmesh minash wake besemjash anentaimtijagme ? Wika ayatak jigkagbau atasanuk umintsan wekaetsujai , wika Apu Jisusa chichame etsegbaunum Jerusalén mantuinakuish jakatasanush wakegajai .

text: And when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , The will of the Lord be done .
text2: Taku depetmain wegachkui , tujinká : — Apu wakegamu atí , — tusa idaisabiaji .

text: And after those days we took up our carriages , and went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Nu tusa idaisa pujusá , chimpiima umintsá Jerusalén ashinkabiaji .

text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea , and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus , an old disciple , with whom we should lodge .
text2: Nu wegajin Cesareanmaya wajumchik Jisusa nemajin aidau uyuntamsagmayi . Nunikag Chiprenmaya Mnasón daagtin nigka duwik nagkamas Jisusa nemajin pujaunum ejetamawagmayi , niina jeen ikapagti tusag .

text: And when we were come to Jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
text2: Jerusalén jegaa ajin nuwiya Jisusa nemajuidau shiig anenjamsag jujamkiagmayi .

text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James ; and all the elders were present .
text2: Kashinia duwi Pablo : Jacobo ijagsami takui , niijai ashinkabiaji . Nui jegakmá ashí Jisusa nemajin aidaun diin batsatbaunum jegawabiaji .

text: And when he had saluted them , he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry .
text2: Nunika ajin Pablo ditan kumpamá , duwi makí makichik ni wekaesamunmayan , judiuchunum wekaebaunmash Apajuí nuní yainkame tusa ditanash ujabi .

text: And when they heard it , they glorified the Lord , and said unto him , Thou seest , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are which believe ; and they are all zealous of the law :
text2: Nunú tabaun antukag Apajuin emematiagmayi . Nunikag Pablon chichajuinak : — Dekas yatsujuh pegkejai ame tame duka , tujash amesh wainme dekapamainchau iina patayí judío aidau Jisukristun dekaskeapi tusag nemajuina duka . Nuna nuninakush ditak , Moisés chicham umiktinun ukugtamkimua duka tuke idaitsuk umigmainai tuinawai .

text: And they are informed of thee , that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , saying that they ought not to circumcise their children , neither to walk after the customs .
text2: “ Tujash amina chichagtamainak , auk nigka ashí iina patayí judío aidaun , nuigtú judiuchu aidau batsataina nunash jintintak : ‘ Moisés chicham umiktajum timawa duka umigmaitsugme , uchi aishmagkuch akiinkuish , pakagkagmek ajapjumaitsugme , iina muunji takajakua dushakam atumek idaisatajum ’ , tusa tawai tujamaina nunash ,

text: What is it therefore ? the multitude must needs come together : for they will hear that thou art come .
text2: ¿ wajuk asamtaiya tujamainawa ? Nunú tabaun antú batsata nunidau asag , ame juwi taamugmin dekagtamainakug kautjamkagtatui .

text: Do therefore this that we say to thee : We have four men which have a vow on them ;
text2: Nunin asamtai ju dutikmainaitme : Jutii ainag juwi , cuatro aents yamai umiktatus batsatainawai Apajuí anagkuamun .

text: Them take , and purify thyself with them , and be at charges with them , that they may shave their heads : and all may know that those things , whereof they were informed concerning thee , are nothing ; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly , and keepest the law .
text2: Nunú yajuakam wetá nunikam ditajai pegkeeta , dutikam ju aents diwimkagtukagmataish ame akikmatkata , dutikawamin ditá intashin tsupigtinme . Nunú nunikamin ashí waipakag amina augmatjamsag tujamiagbaunash wainkampap tuinawa , niish dekas Moisés tibau ii umiinag nunash imatiksagkeap umiawa , tujabiagtatui .

text: As touching the Gentiles which believe , we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing , save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols , and from blood , and from strangled , and from fornication .
text2: Judiuchu aidau Jisusan dekaskeapi tusag nemajuina dushakam , ashí apajimtai aidau anagkuamu aina duka yuwawaigpajum , tsanijintash tsanijinawaigpajum , kuntin ayatak pempeaja maamu aina nuna nejesh , numpashkam yuwawaigpajum tusa agatjabiaji ” , tiaju .

text: Then Paul took the men , and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple , to signify the accomplishment of the days of purifcation , until that an offering should be offered for every one of them .
text2: Tusa tima cuatro aentsú yajuak we , kashinia duwi ditajai pegkediag , jega Apajuí ememattainum Pablo wayaa , sacerdoten chichajak : — Jutii pegkeemu tsawan umintaik makí makichik kuntinun sumakag , Apajuin anentag susatasag taawagtatui , — tusa ujakajui .

text: And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews which were of Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the people , and laid hands on him ,
text2: Nuna tusa tuke duti dutikakua siete tsawan ejetatak wajamunum , wajumak judío Asia nugkanum batsamin aidau , Pablo jega Apajuí ememattainum pujaun wainkag , ashí aentsun ujakag dapampakaju . Dutikawag Pablon achikag ,

text: Crying out , Men of Israel , help : This is the man , that teacheth all men every where against the people , and the law , and this place : and further brought Greeks also into the temple , and hath polluted this holy place .
text2: senchi untsumjukag : “ ¡ Israel aents aidauwah , yainkatajum ! Ju aentsua juuwai ashí nugkanum wekagas , aentsun jintintak : Jutii judío aidauti umigtaiji aidauk umigkaigpajum taku , Moisés chicham umiktajum tiuwa nunash pegkegchau chichajak , jega Apajuí ememattaiya junash aikasag pegkegchau chichajú wekaenuwe duka . Nuigtú yamaishkam griego aents aidaun jega Apajuí ememattai pegkegma juwi utsaa pegkegchau awasae . ”

text: ( For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple . )
text2: Nunak , Trófimo Efesonmaya nujai Pablo yaaktanum wekagun wainkaju asag , jega Apajuí ememattainmash awayaestai tusag tiajui .

text: And all the city was moved , and the people ran together : and they took Paul , and drew him out of the temple : and forthwith the doors were shut .
text2: Nuna antukag ashí nu yaaktanmayag pampaidau . Nuninak pisajag kautuawag , Pablonak achikag jega Apajuí ememattainum wajaun japikí agaa jiyamuik , wamkesag waitinak epetiagmayi .

text: And as they went about to kill him , tidings came unto the chief captain of the band , that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
